headline: Chinese state media accuses Australia of ‚Äòbarbaric behaviour disgusting double standards‚Äô
text: China‚Äôs state-run media has accused Australia of ‚Äúbarbaric behaviour‚Äù over the extraction of two Australia journalists earlier this week. Tensions peak in the territorial dispute over the South China Sea as the US toughens military stance against Beijing. China has accused Australia of ‚Äòbarbaric behaviour‚Äô despite Australian journalists fleeing China. Picture: Anthony Wallace/AFPSource:AFP It‚Äôs taken days for anything resembling a response from China about the extraction of two Australia journalists from the country earlier this week. Now a comment has been made but not unsurprisingly Chinese media has instead taken aim at Australia accusing it of ‚Äúdisgusting double standards‚Äù and of conducting a ‚Äúwitch hunt‚Äù.  The comments in Chinese state media come as diplomatic relations between Beijing and Canberra continue to plummet even as many trade links remain solid. On Tuesday the China correspondents for the ABC and The Australian Financial Review Bill Birtles and Mike Smith arrived back in Sydney after police came to there respective homes in China in the middle of the night and demanded they present themselves for questioning. The pair sought shelter in Australian missions due to fears they would be arbitrarily detained and were later allowed to depart the country. The journos were already planning to leave following the arrest of Australian Cheng Lei who worked for a Chinese state broadcaster and who local authorities have said ‚Äúendangered national security‚Äù. RELATED: Two Australian reporters extracted from China  The Australian Financial Review's Michael Smith (left) and the ABC's Bill Birtles flew out of Shanghai on Monday night. Picture: ABC.Source:Supplied It has since emerged that Australia has now cancelled the visas of two Chinese academics Chen Hong and Li Jianjun who can now not re-enter the country. It‚Äôs also believed four Chinese journalists left Australia earlier this year after being questioned by ASIO. Police and security services have been investigating alleged attempts by the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) to influence proceedings at the New South Wales state parliament. Since Birtles‚Äô and Smith‚Äôs departure Chinese officials and media have focused instead on the four Chinese journalists who left Australia reportedly after their homes were raided as part of the ASIO investigation. That‚Äôs despite barely a peep from Chinese media when the raids occurred in June. A piece from the CCP aligned Global Times from late yesterday said Australia was engaged in an ‚Äúextreme anti-China witch-hunt‚Äù which was a ‚ÄúMcCarthyism-style horrific persecution of Chinese journalists and scholars‚Äù. The article does not have a byline and is listed as a ‚Äúviewpoint‚Äù but no articles in the Global Times go against Beijing‚Äôs wishes. Indeed many of the sentences used the same phrasing as China‚Äôs foreign affairs spokesman when he piled into Australia on the same day. The article was illustrated with a picture of a benign looking panda staring at an angry kangaroo. ‚ÄúThe witch hunt campaign under the excuse of investigating the so-called Chinese infiltration promoted by Australian security departments is getting infuriating‚Äù the piece stated. ‚ÄúThe raid was a horrendous violation of the basic rights and freedom of the press of the Chinese journalists.‚Äù That line might come as a surprise to countless Western journalists who claim they have been harassed in China by authorities with many now expelled not allowed into the country or like Cheng in detention. RELATED: China fires ballistic missiles as warning to US Australian journalist Cheng Lei has been held since at least August 14 2020. Picture: Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade/Australia Global Alumni/AFP.Source:AFP ‚ÄúIt is unbelievable that such barbaric behaviour actually happened in broad daylight in a country that claims to be a free and democratic country‚Äù it said of the raids in Australia. ‚ÄúAustralia‚Äòs so-called freedom of the press and freedom of speech have become a complete joke.‚Äù As in most Global Times‚Äô pieces the author accused Australia of being subservient to the US. Although it said that Australia was carrying out the policies of Washington D.C. in a more ‚Äúruthless way‚Äù. ‚ÄúThe intent of Australian authorities is clear ‚Äì they want to hype the anti-China sentiment to the largest extent possible so that political figures who hold somewhat neutral views fear voicing their opinion which in turn has led to anti-China Australian public opinion to become one-sided.‚Äù The piece was one of the first from inside China to reference the departure of the two Australian journalists. It attempted to compare the treatment of Birtles and Smith with the four Chinese journalists. Angry roo benign panda. How Chinese media outlet Global Times illustrates the relationship. Picture: Liu Rui/GT.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúChinese authorities did not search their residences or electronic devices. However Australian media has spared no efforts in discrediting China‚Äòs actions deliberately fabricating a scene in which China suppresses journalists from Western countries. ‚ÄúSuch double standard is disgusting. To be honest the bizarre logic of Australian journalists leaves us speechless‚Äù the piece frothed. On Wednesday China‚Äòs Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokesman Zhao Lijian also attacked the June raids. ‚ÄúThe Australian Government‚Äòs behaviour severely interrupts the normal reporting of Chinese media outlets in Australia blatantly violates the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese journalists there and caused severe harm to the physical and mental health of the journalists and their families.‚Äù Mr Zhao said China had asked Australia to ‚Äúimmediately stop such blatant irrational behaviours stop harassing and oppressing Chinese personnel in Australia‚Äù. China has accused Australia of ‚Äúbarbaric behaviour‚Äù despite Australian journalists fleeing Chine. Picture: Anthony Wallace/AFPSource:AFP Former ASIO director-general Dennis Richardson told The Australian on Thursday that the treatment of Birtles and Smith was incomparable to the raids of Chinese journalists. ‚ÄúForeign journalists in China are being systematically harassed and ‚Ä¶ those that have left China have done so out of concern for their own safety or they have been expelled by the Chinese.‚Äù Investigating Chinese journalists in Australia in the context of an investigation into foreign interference was ‚Äúlegitimate‚Äù Mr Richardson said. Last week a Global Times editorial called Australians ‚Äúpoor white trash‚Äù and darkly warned there will be ‚Äúconsequences‚Äù if we don‚Äôt play nice with China. Australia it claimed was ‚Äúprovoking China‚Äù and was on a ‚Äúlose-lose path‚Äù that would ‚Äúundoubtedly cause huge damage to its already severely injured economy‚Äù. ‚ÄúThe momentum of trade liberalisation investment facilitation economic complementarity and normalisation of cultural exchanges has come to an abrupt end‚Äù it said. The publication recalled an infamous 1980 quote about Australia from then Singapore Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew. ‚ÄúIf Australia doesn‚Äôt open up its economy and reduce unemployment it risks becoming the ‚Äòpoor white trash of Asia‚Äô the Global Times editorial stated. headline: US election fundraising: Donald Trump‚Äôs campaign has spent $800 million
text: A few months ago Donald Trump‚Äôs election campaign had a huge money advantage over his opponent. Now it‚Äôs almost gone. What happened? President Donald Trump's final night speech at the Republican National Convention took aim at Democratic rival Joe Biden. US President Donald Trump. Picture: Brendan Smialowski/AFPSource:AFP A few months ago US President Donald Trump had one massive indisputable advantage over his election opponent Joe Biden. Money. When Mr Biden wrapped up the Democratic presidential nomination in April having expended most of his energy and money on an exhausting primary contest Mr Trump‚Äôs re-election campaign had almost $US200 million more cash on hand. The gap in resources between the two campaigns seemed insurmountable. It was the result of a hugely impressive fundraising effort from the President which started years ago and has not stopped since. In all between the start of 2019 and the end of July this year the Trump campaign and the Republican Party raised a staggering $1.1 billion. Here‚Äôs another staggering figure though: $800 million. That is how much the campaign has already spent with two months still to go until polling day. Where did all the money go? We‚Äôll get to that in a moment. Meanwhile the Biden campaign is catching up. Mr Biden and the Democratic Party recently revealed they had brought in $364 million in August alone blowing away the previous one-month fundraising record of $193 million which was set by Barack Obama in 2008. The Trump campaign has yet to report its own August figure but the situation is worrying enough for the President that he is considering pouring $100 million of his own personal fortune into the campaign‚Äôs coffers according to Bloomberg News. RELATED: The massive money advantage Trump had over Biden Where did Trump‚Äôs $800 million go? Picture: Brendan Smialowski/AFPSource:AFP The baffling ‚Äúevaporation‚Äù of Mr Trump‚Äôs cash advantage was the subject of a thorough in-depth investigation published by The  New York Times this week. Senior reporters Maggie Haberman and Shane Goldmacher interviewed dozens of current and former campaign workers and examined thousands of items in filing documents. ‚ÄúSome people inside the campaign are forecasting what was once unthinkable ‚Äì a cash crunch with less than 60 days until the election‚Äù they wrote. The report included a bunch of examples of the extravagant spending Mr Trump‚Äôs campaign engaged in under the direction of its original manager Brad Parscale whom the President rather pointedly replaced in mid-July. Here are some of the highlights. The campaign paid $11 million to air TV ads during the Super Bowl dwarfing in a single evening the total amount it had spent on ads in several crucial swing states. It blew more than a million dollars airing ads in the Washington D.C. media market where Mr Trump resides and watches TV even though the American capital is overwhelmingly Democratic. Hillary Clinton won more than 90 per cent of the vote there in 2016. In all more than $100 million went into TV ads before the two major parties‚Äô conventions which are generally seen to mark the point at which voters actually start to pay attention to the election. About $800000 was spent boosting Mr Parscale‚Äôs own social media posts which featured Trump campaign ads. More than $30 million went towards manufacturing Trump merchandise like his famous ‚ÄúMake America Great Again‚Äù caps. The campaign incurred $21 million in legal costs covering Mr Trump‚Äôs defence in the impeachment trial and other investigations. It blew six million dollars on ‚Äúmementos‚Äù for donors like White House themed M&Ms. Yondr a company that makes magnetic pouches got more than $100000. The pouches were used during fundraisers to ensure donors could not secretly record the President and then leak his comments to the media. The campaign blew $325000 on reserving the Ritz-Carlton near Jacksonville for the Republican National Convention after Mr Trump decided to move it from North Carolina to Florida. The event never happened there due to the coronavirus but the campaign is not getting its money back. It spent $156000 organising for planes to pull aerial banners behind them. And in a few of the chunkier expenses it spent $145 million on costs related to sending Americans direct mail $40 million acquiring voters‚Äô email addresses and tens of millions on online advertising asking people to become donors. Mr Trump‚Äôs original 2020 campaign manager and now campaign adviser Brad Parscale. Picture: Mandel Ngan/AFPSource:AFP RELATED: Yes Trump‚Äôs polls are bad but can they be trusted? The result of all this spending which drained most of the campaign‚Äôs $1.1 billion war chest is a race that Mr Trump appears to be losing. The current RealClearPolitics polling average has Mr Biden leading the President by 7.1 per cent. The numbers are tighter when you look only at the crucial battleground states with Mr Biden leading by 3.2 per cent ‚Äì and after the last few years I think all of us are treating the polls with a healthy degree of scepticism anyway. Nevertheless Mr Trump finds himself stuck in a situation where those polls would need to be catastrophically wrong ‚Äì worse than in 2016 ‚Äì for him to win. That doesn‚Äôt feel like a great return on investment. ‚ÄúIf you spend $800 million and you‚Äôre 10 points behind I think you‚Äôve got to answer the question ‚ÄòWhat was the game plan?‚Äô‚Äù veteran Republican political strategist Ed Rollins told The Times. ‚ÄúI think a lot of money was spent when voters weren‚Äôt paying attention.‚Äù He went on to accuse Mr Parscale of spending ‚Äúlike a drunken sailor‚Äù. The paper also interviewed Mr Parscale giving him a chance to defend his decision-making. He said all of the expenditure happened ‚Äúunder the very close eye of the family‚Äù referring to the Trumps. ‚ÄúNo decision was made without their approval‚Äù he said. Mr Trump‚Äôs son-in-law Jared Kushner ‚Äì Ivanka‚Äôs husband ‚Äì is broadly overseeing the campaign despite his existing and presumably busy role in the White House. The man who replaced Mr Parscale current campaign manager Bill Stepien has been on something of a cost-cutting drive. He has for example slashed the number of campaign staff who are allowed to travel to events ‚Äì a practice one anonymous official described as ‚Äúsponsored vacations‚Äù. And there has been a drastic reduction in ad spending even in the swing states. To illustrate that point throughout the last two weeks of August the Biden campaign spent $36 million on TV ads compared to just $5 million for the Trump campaign. The one thing Mr Trump‚Äôs operation still has over Mr Biden‚Äôs is a formidable ‚Äúground game‚Äù. It says its volunteers are knocking on about a million doors each week. The Democrats have largely stayed away from that traditional tactic during the pandemic. The ground game could be a crucial factor. Picture: Mandel Ngan/AFPSource:AFP RELATED: Biden pulls off stunning string of victories on Super Tuesday RELATED: Incredible 72-hour turnaround that saved Biden‚Äôs campaign This situation is not where anyone expected us to be. Mr Trump essentially started to run for re-election as soon as he was sworn into office back in January of 2017. In the same week as his inauguration he applied for a trademark on the initial slogan for his 2020 campaign ‚ÄúKeep America Great‚Äù. To say that was a sign of things to come would be quite the understatement. Since the 1970s when the current framework of campaign finance laws was introduced every other president ‚Äì Reagan Clinton Obama and both Bushes ‚Äì waited until at least their third year in office before holding a re-election fundraiser. Mr Trump held eight of them during his first year. He started to build up his resources for 2020 two years before any Democrat even announced they were running for president. No opportunity for monetisation was wasted. For instance in 2018 Mr Trump‚Äôs campaign enticed donors by promising their names would be displayed during a livestream of Mr Trump‚Äôs State of the Union address. In other words the President‚Äôs team was creative enough to turn the dullest stodgiest most self-serious tradition of US politics into a cash cow. And it worked ‚Äì the campaign ended up raising a million dollars that night off about 75000 different donors. ‚ÄúDemocrats will never catch up. It‚Äôs just too much money‚Äù political strategist Chris Lippincott told Politico last October. ‚ÄúTake away (Mr Trump‚Äôs) craziness and he has an extremely professional operation‚Äù warned Rufus Gifford who presumably knew what he was talking about given he was the finance director for Barack Obama‚Äôs successful re-election campaign in 2012. There are of course limits to what money can accomplish. Just ask Michael Bloomberg who spent more than a billion dollars on his campaign for the Democratic nomination and didn‚Äôt win a single state. Mr Biden himself pulled off an incredible revival to claim the nomination despite being heavily outspent by pretty much everyone else in the primaries. And it‚Äôs worth remembering that Mr Trump actually spent far less than Hillary Clinton in 2016. She raised $1.2 billion for that campaign compared to his $650 million. Money is however one of the most important factors in any election. It lets campaigns hire more staff buy more ads and crucially focus their efforts on more states at once. Without it a presidential candidate is limited to running ads and building a turnout machine in a handful of swing states. With it they can expand the map and attack their opponent all over the place. Donald Trump had the edge. Somehow his campaign has managed to lose it. headline: JobSeeker JobKeeper ending will reveal massive recession crisis
text: In just 14 days time hundreds of thousands of Australians will have their weekly earnings slashed - and then the real financial pain will begin. Going back to previous rates of JobSeeker could have a devastating impact for thousands of Aussies according to a new report by The Australia Institute. Government benefits through COVID have seen us much better off. Picture: Supplied.Source:Supplied The most important graph in Australia right now is this one: The wages shortfall has been replaced by benefits and then some. Picture: Supplied.Source:Supplied RELATED: How much the recession will cost you It comes from the Commonwealth Bank of Australia and it shows how much more money Australians are making than the year before. It‚Äôs a lot. We‚Äôre flying. The black line is now at 16 per cent which means we‚Äôre making 16 per cent more money in 2020 than last year. Think about it like this: Australians who were banking $1000 per week last year are banking on average $1160 now. That‚Äôs a lot of extra money each week. Where is the cash is coming from? Up until the start of the pandemic the black line was being held up by the blue bars: earnings from work i.e. salary and wages. We were 4 or 5 per cent richer than the year before because more wages were being paid. Then the COVID-19 pandemic starts. The blue bars turn slightly negative ‚Äì wages and salaries went down (they would have gone down even more if not for JobKeeper!). But the red bars shoot up. That‚Äôs Treasurer Josh Frydenberg turning on the money taps. JobSeeker is the big one and the two $750 payments that went to pensioners. RELATED: Australia‚Äôs big weakness exposed Treasurer Josh Frydenberg injected cash into the economy like never before to see Australia ride the COVID wave. Picture: Mick Tsikas/AAPSource:AAP The surprising thing is the government payments are so big they‚Äôre enough to actually increase the amount of money being earned by Australians on average. That makes this a very surprising recession. Normally in a recession people get poorer. Not this time. So far anyway. That‚Äôs why this graph is so vital to understand right now. Because those government payments have expiry dates. The two $750 payments are done and dusted for starters. Then there is JobSeeker. That‚Äôs the payment we used to call the dole. It was doubled back in March via a ‚Äúcoronavirus supplement‚Äù of $550 a fortnight. That will go for just one more fortnight before adjusting to $250 a fortnight. Thousands of Aussies will see their fortnightly income fall by $300 on September 24. JobSeeker will also be means-tested from that date so people with a lot of wealth won‚Äôt be eligible. They‚Äôll be booted off the payment. When that happens the overall income of Australians will fall for the first time this recession. And it might start to really feel like a recession. Mark the date: September 24. It doesn‚Äôt help that just four days later on September 28 the JobKeeper payment will also change. Not only will it get smaller ($1200 a week instead of $1500 and reduced to $750 for part-timers) far fewer businesses will qualify for it. People will no doubt be let go by their employers once JobKeeper stops. RELATED: Secret truth behind Aussie recession March saw huge queues outside Centrelink offices and when the JobSeeker and JobKeeper changes hit the unemployment rate could go up again. Picture: Scott Barbour/AAPSource:AAP All this is happening while Victoria is still struggling to get the virus under control and retailers are forbidden from opening their stores to the public. The government is obviously a bit worried about September and it has at the last minute decided to delay another dangerous rule change. Since March companies have been able to run up debts and not repay them. Normally doing that would be enough to make a business go broke. But this year to try to keep businesses alive the government relaxed all the rules. A business could run up more debts and not repay them for longer without the law getting involved. That was due to snap back in September too. But now it has been extended to December 31. That will provide welcome relief in September. (Although it might just delay problems until the new year.) Many people have lost jobs already. The street near my house is already full of vacant shopfronts. But for many Australians it hasn‚Äôt really felt like a recession yet. House prices have remained remarkably steady the stock market has bounced and spending at major retailers has been very strong. JB Hi-Fi is making a motza. That could all change in just two weeks. These sudden shrinkage in these government payments will make that graph look very different as incomes suddenly fall. And we could be experiencing a much more grim mood on the way into Christmas. Jason Murphy is an economist | @jasemurphy. He is the author of the book Incentivology. headline: Katie Holmes‚Äô new boyfriend Emilio Vitolo recently dumped fiancee by text
text: A friend close to the jilted ex of Katie Holmes‚Äô new squeeze Emilio Vitolo has revealed brutal details about their break-up. It‚Äôs The Latest with Bronte and Bucky as the pair recap the entertainment news that made headlines in 2020. Katie Holmes‚Äô new squeeze allegedly dumped his fiancee via text very recently. Picture: Ericka Draves/BackgridSource:BackGrid Katie Holmes‚Äô new actor beau reportedly dumped his ‚Äúblindsided‚Äù fiancee via text just two days before photos emerged of him on a date with Holmes. Sources say the 41-year-old actor who was pictured in a romantic clinch with chef and actor Emilio Vitolo in New York last week had been working with him on a recent indie movie The Sun  reports. According to a friend of Rachel Emmons Vitolo‚Äôs ex she hasn‚Äôt spoken to him since he suddenly ended their engagement after more than 18 months together. RELATED: Katie Holmes‚Äô steamy PDA with new beau Katie Holmes was pictured in a passionate public embrace with actor/chef Emilio Vitolo Jr recently. Picture: Ericka Draves/BackgridSource:BackGrid The source told The Sun: ‚ÄúRachel and Emilio got together in February last year and were engaged after just a few months. It was a whirlwind romance but they were very much in love. ‚ÄúThey were planning their wedding before the pandemic but had been having issues recently ‚Ä¶ different work schedules and COVID made it difficult. ‚ÄúBut Rachel was left blindsided when he suddenly ended their engagement via text on Tuesday just two days before photographs emerged of him with Katie‚Äù the friend claimed. Holmes and Vitolo have reportedly been working on an indie film together. Picture: Getty ImagesSource:News Regional Media ‚ÄúKatie and Emilio were working on an indie movie together about a month ago and Rachel knew that. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs trying to get into acting but nobody really knew who he was until this happened. ‚ÄúRachel found out about their dates after friends sent her articles showing them together. She thinks it‚Äôs disrespectful for it to be so public.‚Äù RELATED: Hollywood‚Äôs most secretive couple splits They added: ‚ÄúThey were close while filming together but she never saw this coming.‚Äù The friend said Rachel has found the situation ‚Äúbizarre and disappointing‚Äù after Katie and Emilio who works at Emilio‚Äôs Ballato in SoHo were seen during an intimate evening in New York last week. During a second date Katie who split with Jamie Foxx last year after a six-year on/off relationship was spotted enjoying a heavy make-out session with Emilio while sitting on his lap. The mum-of-one who has 14-year-old daughter Suri with ex-husband Tom Cruise was seen kissing the 33-year-old on Sunday evening during a night out in Manhattan at the Peasant Restaurant. They have since been spotted smooching a third time in the Big Apple. ‚ÄúEmilio is very charming; he has a lot of friends and a big personality. It‚Äôs understandable Katie has fallen for him‚Äú Rachel‚Äôs friend continued. ‚ÄúBut after being so private in her other relationships it‚Äôs quite shocking to see her sitting on a guy‚Äôs lap in a restaurant. ‚ÄúNobody really knows if Katie was aware he was with Rachel. If she did it‚Äôs a bad example to set for her daughter. ‚ÄúRachel feels Emilio could have been more honest and dealt with it like a gentleman and face-to-face. ‚ÄúShe packed up and left their home on Wednesday and hasn‚Äôt seen him at all since.‚Äù Rachel‚Äôs Instagram is still littered with photographs of the two together while Emilio is understood to have deleted snaps the day after ending their relationship although they were engaging on each other‚Äôs pages for weeks prior to him going public with Katie. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt say Rachel was a fan of Katie before this she didn‚Äôt care about her or pay attention‚Äù the friend said. ‚ÄúNow she doesn‚Äôt think she‚Äôs a bad person but she‚Äôs unsure of her intentions. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a difficult time but Rachel is doing well she‚Äôs focusing on work and herself. ‚ÄúIn a lot of ways she‚Äôs also glad that the wedding was postponed and feels she‚Äôs had a lucky escape.‚Äù The Sun has contacted Holmes‚Äô rep and Emilio. Neither returned calls for comment. headline: Burglar Jordan Constable threatened to make victim‚Äôs daughter ‚Äòdisappear‚Äô from jail
text: A court has been told a burglar threatened to make his victim‚Äôs ‚Äúbaby girl‚Äù disappear if he didn‚Äôt redact statements made to police.  A man and his wife were ‚Äòdevastated‚Äô by the robbery and threat against their pregnant daughter. Picture: SuppliedSource:News Regional Media A desperate burglar threatened to make his victim‚Äôs ‚Äúbaby girl‚Äù disappear if the man didn‚Äôt retract ‚Äúnegative‚Äù statements made to police.   But the plot backfired and Jordan Constable later pleaded guilty to an attempt to pervert the course of justice. He was spared jail for the crime and was instead ordered to serve a three-year-community corrections order in the County Court of Victoria on Thursday. The 36-year-old wrote a letter to a victim of his burglary and offered to pay him $10000 for positive statements and a return of goods. ‚ÄúI see how much you adore and love your baby girl ‚Ä¶ it would be hard as (a) father knowing you could prevent your daughter disappearing but did nothing or the wrong move instead of following orders and making a healthy 10k of which will help your retirement‚Äù the burglar wrote. Convicted burglar Jordan Constable wrote a letter threatening a man‚Äôs daughter and offering $10000 if he changed his statement.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt f**k this up ‚Äì for your baby girl‚Äôs sake.‚Äù The threatening letter was sent to the victim‚Äôs Hallam house in March last year while Constable was on remand for the burglary. He was later sentenced to 217 days jail and an 18-month community corrections order for the crime. ‚ÄúI really don‚Äôt care exactly what is said just retract all negative statements against Jordan all items returned as his possessions make a positive statement ‚Ä¶ you are covered by insurance so make sure you get IT DONE!!‚Äù Constable wrote. The threatening letter was signed ‚ÄúMr K‚Äù but a handwriting analysis found it matched another letter Constable wrote which he claimed was a diary entry. The man and his wife were ‚Äúdevastated‚Äù by the burglary and the threat against their pregnant daughter. ‚ÄúThe offender knows everything about us and has invaded every inch of our lives‚Äù the wife told the court. The couple asked their daughter to move interstate with her husband out of fear. The judge issued a stern warning to Constable before he sentenced him. The convicted burglar was at Fulham Correctional Centre when he mailed the threatening letter.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúI tell you now ‚Ä¶ You come back here having breached it and just bring your toothbrush you won‚Äôt need counsel. You‚Äôll go straight to jail‚Äù Judge Michael McInerney told the convicted burglar. Prosecutors wanted Constable jailed for the crime but the letter writer wanted to avoid going back behind bars. His defence lawyer Jonathan Brancato argued the letter was ‚Äúspontaneous‚Äù Constable had been recovering from a serious drug addiction and it came ‚Äúfrom a place of desperation‚Äù. Constable will be subject to random drug tests offender behaviour therapy 200 hours of community work as part of the order and was ordered to pay $3000 which was put on hold for 18 months. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let me down Mr Constable‚Äù the judge said. headline: Ming-Na Wen original voice of Mulan made a surprise cameo in 2020 version
text: If you were playing close attention in the live action Mulan you may have spotted an excellent cameo of the original voice of Mulan. The first look at Disney's live-action Mulan remake starring Yifei Liu. The voice of Mulan in the 1998 version Ming-Na Wen has a special cameo in the new version. Picture: Rich Polk/Getty Images for DisneySource:Getty Images OK so there wasn‚Äôt any singing. And there wasn‚Äôt a talking dragon named ahem Mushu. But fans of the 1998 animated version of Disney‚Äôs Mulan still had a special Easter egg to find in new live action Mulan ‚Äì if they were paying attention. Ming-Na Wen who voiced Mulan in the ‚Äô90s version had a blink-and-you‚Äôll-miss-it cameo right at the end of the film released to Disney+ this past Friday. Wen is the woman who introduces Mulan played now by Yifei Liu at court to the emperor. In the credits you‚Äôll spot Wen‚Äôs name next to the character of ‚Äúesteemed guest‚Äù. And she is in more ways than one. Did you spot Ming-Na Wen in the new live action Mulan?Source:Supplied Ming-Na Wen starred in seven seasons of Marvel series Agents of SHIELD. Picture: Dia Dipasupil/Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images RELATED: Mulan review The cameo almost didn‚Äôt happen Wen revealed to  The New York Times  in an interview. Originally Wen was supposed to have a role at the beginning of the film in the matchmaker scene as the potential mother-in-law but the part required her to be in Auckland where they shot most of Mulan for a month. But Wen is a regular on Marvel TV series Agents of SHIELD also produced by Disney. ‚ÄúThe producers of Agents of SHIELD just threw up their hands ‚ÄòWe can‚Äôt lose you for a month!‚Äô. I totally understood and I‚Äôm always very Zen about this stuff‚Äù Wen told The New York Times. ‚ÄúI said ‚ÄòLook if it was meant to be it was meant to be. We all tried and it‚Äôs too bad.‚Äô ‚ÄúWe sort of let it go and then (producer) Jason (Reed) and (director) Niki (Caro) came up with this great idea where instead of shooting an entire scene I‚Äôd just make a cameo at the very end to announce Mulan to the emperor. ‚ÄúI thought that was very appropriate and just wonderful a little Easter egg where I could pass the baton. And this time they only needed me there for a week. So it all worked out!‚Äù The 1998 animated version remains a favourite.Source:News Corp Australia RELATED: Disney faces perfect storm in Mulan release Wen who has starred in films including the Joy Luck Club and Prom Night recently voiced Mulan again in Ralph Breaks the Internet. It was in a scene with a bunch of Disney princesses whose characters were voiced by the women who originated the characters including Idina Menzel as Elsa Kelly Macdonald as Merida Mandy Moore as Rapunzel and Auli‚ÄôI Cravalho as Moana. She also recently appeared in an episode of The Mandalorian while Agents of SHIELD wrapped up in May after seven seasons. Mulan is available to stream on Disney+.Source:Supplied The new version of Mulan was originally scheduled to be released in cinemas in late March but had its plans disrupted by coronavirus shutdowns. Attempts to reschedule it eventually led to its streaming release in markets where Disney+ is available. The film costs an extra $34.99 to access and is not included in the cost of a Disney+ subscription. From December 4 Mulan will be available for all subscribers. The live action version has been embroiled in two controversies including one that sparked a boycott movement after lead actor Liu voiced her support for Hong Kong police during violent confrontations with democracy protesters. Since the film‚Äôs release activists have pointed to the film‚Äôs credits where producers thanked Chinese government organisations in the Xinjiang province where Mulan was partly filmed. The Xinjiang province is where a million Chinese ethnic minority Uighur people have been detained and placed in ‚Äúre-education‚Äù centres. headline: Studio 10 co-host Joe Hildebrand announces he is leaving the show
text: After weeks of speculation Joe Hildebrand has revealed that he is leaving Studio 10 as the show undergoes a massive shake-up. Joe Hildebrand has decided to leave Studio 10. Joe Hildebrand has announced he‚Äôs leaving Studio 10.Source:Channel 10 The Studio 10 co-hosts were all in tears this morning as Joe Hildebrand announced he was leaving the show. ‚ÄúI am leaving Studio 10‚Äù Hildebrand who been on the show since it started in 2013 said on air. ‚ÄúI have given it a huge amount of thought. It has been really hard.‚Äù Channel 10 announced last month that Studio 10 was getting a major shake-up due to cost cuts with Kerri-Anne Kennerley and Natarsha Belling set to leave the program. Joe Hildebrand has announced he‚Äôs leaving Studio 10.Source:Channel 10 RELATED: ‚ÄòHeartbroken‚Äô Studio 10 hosts address axing on-air Hildebrand who writes a weekly column for news.com.au was offered a diminished role on the show and spent the last few weeks weighing up his future. ‚ÄúWe all know the show is getting a bit of a shake-up‚Äù he said on Studio 10 today. ‚ÄúChannel 10 and my lovely bosses asked me if I would stay in a new role. We talked warmly and openly about what that might look like and they were really keen and really lovely about it.‚Äù But in the end Hildebrand decided it was better to leave the program and ‚Äúgive the new show whatever it may look like a chance to breathe and have a fresh start without me hanging around‚Äù. His last day on air will be tomorrow. Hildebrand was visibly emotional as he thanked Sarah Harris who he called his ‚Äúbest friend my work wife‚Äù. Joe Hildebrand shared a touching moment with Sarah Harris.Source:Channel 10 RELATED: Read Joe Hildebrand‚Äôs most recent news.com.au columns He also thanked the show‚Äôs viewers saying: ‚ÄúPeople often stare down their nose at daytime television because it is only watched by pensioners at home or ‚Ä¶ housewives. They‚Äôre the people I love. They‚Äôre the battlers. They‚Äôre people who have often had really tough lives and they‚Äôve overcome that and I just draw great strength and inspiration from them.‚Äù As for what he‚Äôll do next Hildebrand said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm talking to other people about exciting stuff that I can do.‚Äù After announcing the news on-air Hilderband took to Twitter to release his official statement. Thank you so so much everybody! I am still trying to reply to everyone but in the meantime here‚Äôs my statement on leaving @Studio10au: pic.twitter.com/k4pCUx6cCT THE NEW STUDIO 10 Channel 10 announced on the weekend that Dancing With The Stars judge Tristan MacManus would be joining Studio 10 as Sarah Harris‚Äô co-host from September 14 onwards. Narelda Jacobs will continue to read the news Angela Bishop will cover entertainment and Denise Drysdale Craig Bennett and Jono Coleman will still appear from time to time. Studio 10‚Äôs executive producer Tamara Simoneau said at the time: ‚ÄúWhen searching for the right co-host to join Sarah at the helm of Studio 10 we wanted to think outside the box and choose someone who would help bring plenty of extra sunshine to morning TV at a time when it‚Äôs needed most. Dancing With the Stars‚Äô Tristan MacManus. Picture: Richard DobsonSource:News Corp Australia RELATED: Joe Hildebrand on the moment that could see Trump win the US election ‚ÄúTristan is charming funny and fresh with a cheeky Irish side that he‚Äôs ready to share with Australia. He might even turn our studio into a dancefloor from time to time and we‚Äôre completely OK with that.‚Äù Comments To join the conversation please Log in. Don't have an account? headline: Lily Allen‚Äôs husband David Harbour‚Äôs struggle with bipolar mental asylums
text: Lily Allen‚Äôs new husband has previously talked candidly about his struggles with bipolar saying he spent time in a ‚Äúmental asylum‚Äù. THE ENGLISH singer has downplayed revelations from her upcoming autobiography in an interview with The Project. David Harbour and singer Lily Allen recently got married in Las Vegas. Picture: davidharbour/InstagramSource:Instagram Lily Allen‚Äôs new husband David Harbour has previously talked candidly about his struggles with bipolar saying he felt like he was ‚Äúconnected to god‚Äù and was committed to a ‚Äúmental asylum‚Äù. In 2018 Harbour 45 talked candidly on a podcast about his struggles with the affective disorder saying during a difficult period in his 20s he was put in a ‚Äúmental asylum‚Äù. ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the interesting thing which I‚Äôve actually never truly spoken about publicly‚Äù Harbour told Marc Maron on WTF. ‚ÄúI actually was in this Catholicism thing ‚Ä¶ and I was sober for like a year and a half I was 25 and I actually did have a manic episode and I was diagnosed as bipolar‚Äù the Stranger Things star said. ‚ÄúI really had like a bit of a break where I thought I was in connection to some sort of God that I wasn‚Äôt really in connection to‚Äù Harbour said. ‚ÄúIt was like I had all the answers suddenly.‚Äù RELATED: Inside Lily Allen‚Äôs wild Vegas wedding Lily Allen and David Harbour recently wed in Las Vegas. Picture: davidharbour/InstagramSource:Instagram  RELATED: Lily Allen appears to confirm she‚Äôs engaged to David Harbour Harbour said he wasn‚Äôt doing drugs or drinking at the time and was eventually put in a facility by his family. ‚ÄúNo drugs. The interesting thing about it is that I realised I don‚Äôt need (drugs)‚Äù Harbour said. ‚ÄúI have a capacity to see the elves in the corners of the room if I really allow myself to go there. ‚ÄúI was taken by my parents to a mental asylum and I have to say one thing about the mental asylums: Being in a mental asylum is really not as fun as you think ‚Ä¶ it winds up being sad. ‚ÄúIt smells like sh*t. It‚Äôs horrible.‚Äù Harbour said he‚Äôd been taking psychiatric medication ever since the incident. ‚ÄúThe funny thing about my brain is every time I‚Äôve had an episode like that it‚Äôs coupled with spirituality‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúGenerally people are like ‚ÄòI need to meditate more‚Äô or ‚ÄòI need to get into yoga‚Äô. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been medicated for bipolar for a long time. I‚Äôve had a struggle going on and off the medications. You think you‚Äôre not the artist you could be. Let‚Äôs open this baby up! ‚ÄúThe minute I get close to that flame of the answers the mysticism I‚Äôm out of my mind‚Äù he said. RELATED: Andy Lee reveals he dated Lily Allen Stranger Things actor David Harbour. Picture: InstagramSource:Supplied David Harbour and Lily Allen confirmed their relationship in September last year. Picture: Charley Gallay/Getty Images for NetflixSource:Getty Images Harbour and Allen 35 recently wed at a tiny ceremony in Las Vegas officiated by an Elvis Presley impersonator. The couple were married just a day after TMZ reported they‚Äôd purchased a wedding licence and had a reception at In-N-Out-Burger. Harbour and Allen first went public with their relationship just over a year ago in August 2019. The public outing came just a few months after Harbour had split with former girlfriend singer Alison Sudol. ‚ÄúIn a wedding officiated by the king himself the people‚Äôs princess wed her devoted low born but kind credit card holder in a beautiful ceremony lit by the ashen skies courtesy of a burning state miles away in the midst of a global pandemic‚Äù Harbour wrote on Instagram sharing photos of the wedding. ‚ÄúRefreshments were served at a small reception following.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: Lisa Wilkinson once interviewed Kim Kardashian with her fly undone
text: Lisa Wilkinson has recalled her very first interview with Kim Kardashian 10 years ago ‚Äì revealing a hilarious behind-the-scenes titbit. Kim Kardashian West has sat down with Lisa Wilkinson for an intimate interview and the line of questioning has taken a royal route. Lisa Wilkinson. Picture: Instagram.Source:Supplied Project host Lisa Wilkinson has revealed she once spent a chunk of her work day with her fly undone. But in a far less relatable twist her wardrobe malfunction happened live on national television while she was interviewing reality TV royalty Kim Kardashian no less. Taking to Instagram today off the back of the news Keeping Up With The Kardashians will wrap up after its 20th season Wilkinson shared footage of her first ever chat with the star on the Today show in 2010. She revealed that during an ad break Kardashian alerted her to her open zipper ‚Äì adding that she is ‚Äúforever grateful‚Äù for the pick-up. RELATED: ‚ÄòGoodbye‚Äô: Kim announces end of KUWTK Lisa Wilkinson once interviewed Kim K with her fly undone. Picture: Instagram.Source:Instagram ‚Äú2010 throwback to Kim Kardashian‚Äù the former Channel 9 star wrote. ‚ÄúWith news this week that Keeping Up With The Kardashians will be no more I thought a few of you might get a giggle out of this throwback interview on the Today show. ‚ÄúIt was the first time I‚Äôd interviewed her and I will be forever grateful that just before we came back from the break Kim pointed out that I might want to do my fly up‚Äù she wrote along with the embarrassed emoji. She added: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs also a reminder of how much things have changed for her (and me) over the last decade. ‚ÄúOne thing I know for sure: my shoulder pad game that day was STRONG!!!‚Äù RELATED: The wildest KUWTK moments in history The Project star is certainly not wrong about how times have changed for both women. Nine years later in her new role with the Ten Network Wilkinson interviewed Kardashian ‚Äì who had exploded in fame from the show‚Äôs beginnings ‚Äì in a far more intimate setting. She wore a skirt this time around so it‚Äôs safe to assume history did not repeat itself. During the exclusive wide-ranging interview for The Sunday Project which airedin November last year Wilkinson ‚Äì who flew to LA for the cosy one-on-one chat ‚Äì asked a dressing gown-clad Kardashian whether she felt sympathy for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. Lisa and Kim sat down for a far more in-depth interview just last year. Picture: Channel 10Source:Channel 10 ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to work out who is the most famous family in the world‚Äù Wilkinson began. ‚ÄúI think it sat as a toss-up between the British royals and the Kardashians‚Äù she said as the 39-year-old businesswoman laughed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm wondering if you feel some sympathy for what Harry and Meghan are going through?‚Äù ‚ÄúI think everyone has their own journey‚Äù Kardashian replied. ‚ÄúI think their journey is extremely personal with ‚Äì you know what his mother experienced and how her life was so affected by the spotlight and by paparazzi. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think anyone can really understand what that‚Äôs like except for them. But I think as I‚Äôm older and as I have kids what I would want for them is just the safest place. ‚ÄúI can definitely empathise with their ‚Äì empathise with their need for having a secure safe place and taking time for themselves and having privacy when they need it.‚Äù This was just a few months before the couple announced they were stepping back from their roles as senior royals. Elsewhere in the interview the mum-of-four spoke about raising her children her famous family her relationship with the White House that risque Met Gala dress and her surprise career move announced in 2019 ‚Äì following in her father Robert‚Äôs footsteps to become a lawyer. Kim made the bombshell KUWTK announcement on Instagram this week. Picture: Getty Images.Source:Getty Images Yesterday Kim Kardashian publicly announced she and her family have made the ‚Äúdifficult decision‚Äù to say goodbye to the reality show that made them household names. ‚ÄúIt is with heavy hearts that we‚Äôve made the difficult decision as a family to say goodbye to Keeping Up with the Kardashians‚Äù the reality star and beauty mogul announced on Instagram following months of intense scrutiny about her turbulent marriage to the rapper-turned-Presidential hopeful. ‚ÄúAfter what will be 14 years 20 seasons hundreds of episodes and numerous spin-off shows we are beyond grateful to all of you who‚Äôve watched us for all of these years ‚Äì through the good times the bad times the happiness the tears and the many relationships and children. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll forever cherish the wonderful memories and countless people we‚Äôve met along the way.‚Äù Lisa interviewed Kim just three years after the show first aired. Picture: Instagram.Source:Instagram Kardashian thanked the ‚Äúthousands of individuals and businesses that have been a part of this experience‚Äù and revealed the final season of Keeping Up with the Kardashians would air early next year. The latest season filmed during the coronavirus pandemic will hit Binge on September 18. The star ‚Äì who was best known as Paris Hilton‚Äôs assistant when she made her foray into reality TV with occasional cameos on The Simple Life ‚Äì acknowledged just how much KUWTK had changed her family‚Äôs lives. You can watch season 18 of Keeping Up With the Kardashians on Binge Australia‚Äôs new streaming service offering the best drama entertainment and movies from the world‚Äôs best creators. New to Binge? Get a two week free trial. Sign up at binge.com.au ‚ÄúWithout Keeping Up with The Kardashians I wouldn‚Äôt be where I am today. I am so incredibly grateful to everyone who has watched and supported me and my family these past 14 incredible years‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúThis show made us who we are and I will be forever in debt to everyone who played a role in shaping our careers and changing our lives forever.‚Äù Fans will stop ‚Äòkeeping up‚Äô after the final season in 2021. Picture: AFP.Source:AFP The family‚Äôs surprise decision to ditch the reality show that made them stars came after increased attention on the tumultuous relationship between Kim and Kanye. The rapper is continuing his bizarre bid to run for President during the November US elections and in July slammed his wife and her family on social media accusing Kim and Kris Jenner of trying to ‚Äúlock him up‚Äù. Keeping Up With the Kardashians Season 19 premieres Friday September 18 ‚Äì same day as the U.S. Watch on E! at 10am and 8.30pm on Foxtel or Fetch. headline: Benji Marshall Leichhardt Oval farewell killed off by NRL
text: The NRL has shut down Benji Marshall‚Äôs fairytale Wests Tigers farewell with health experts stepping in to stop a bizarre double-booking blunder. NRL 360: The Wests Tigers want Storm winger Josh Addo-Carr but they won't pay him fullback money in a deal that would likely come with incentives. Benji Marshall has played his last game at Leichhardt Oval.Source:AAP Not like this. Not like this.  Benji Marshall‚Äôs fairytale farewell from the Tigers at Leichhardt Oval has been shut down by the NRL. The Wests Tigers confirmed on Thursday afternoon its plans to relocate its Round 20 home game to the iconic suburban venue has been pulled because of the league‚Äôs biosecurity fears. The club statement revealed the plan was derailed because Leichhardt Oval would have been double booked with earlier junior league grand finals. on the same day. Kayo is your ticket to the 2020 NRL Telstra Premiership. Every game of every round Live & On-Demand with no-ad breaks during play. New to Kayo? Get your 14-day free trial & start streaming instantly > Under advice from the NRL‚Äôs health experts the league stopped the plan because it was impossible for the Tigers to transform the venue from local football oval to NRL venue in the space of a few hours. ‚ÄúBoth grounds are scheduled to host junior league Grand Finals on the weekend of Round 20 with biosecurity experts advising that there would be insufficient time to transform either ground from a junior league football venue to the standards required to meet the Apollo Protocols in time for the 7:30pm kick off‚Äù the club statement claimed. ‚ÄúWith Junior League Grand Final Day scheduled on this date Wests Tigers saw this as a potential opportunity for our club to showcase rugby league and connect with our Junior League clubs. With this in mind ‚Äî and under the current strict biosecurity measures implemented by the NRL ‚Äî the club was unable to get this initiative approved based on the increased level of high-risk for all involved.‚Äù Benji won‚Äôt be coming back.Source:Getty Images According to reports last week the Tigers were prepared to shift their Round 20 home game against the Eels at Bankwest Stadium to Leichhardt Oval ‚Äî giving up around $100000 in potential revenue. However the NRL stepped in to shut the plan down. The NRL‚Äôs strict COVID-19 protocols mean that just 7500 fans are allowed to attend matches at Bankwest Stadium while at Leichhardt Oval that number slips to just 3200. Marshall said last month he was less than pleased to have discovered he was no longer wanted at the club through news reports. ‚ÄúIf anything I was a bit disappointed the way I found out reading it in the paper. That was a little bit disappointing for me‚Äù Marshall said on Fox League‚Äôs NRL360. ‚ÄúI had a good chat with the coach; he laid out where I stood. I appreciated the honesty I can finish the season and then both parties will move on. It was pretty normal (the chat with Maguire). ‚ÄúThat is one of the best things I‚Äôve had under Michael is that he‚Äôs always been honest with me. ‚ÄúWhen you hear about not being wanted through other sources that are not the coach or the club you want to find out if it‚Äôs true or not so I went in there and asked if it‚Äôs true or not. He asked for 24 hours to give me an answer and the answer came back I won‚Äôt be required.‚Äù A club statement released on Tuesday afternoon confirmed the split with Marshall as the Tigers look towards the future. Benji Marshall and the Tigers are finally going their own ways.Source:Getty Images ‚ÄúAs a club we were thrilled to welcome Benji back to Wests Tigers in 2018 and to see him return in a leadership role in this part of his career‚Äù said Wests Tigers CEO Justin Pascoe. ‚ÄúOver the past two-and-a-half years Benji has performed as we knew he would on field but the reality with our roster management is that he will not be with Wests Tigers next year. ‚ÄúDecisions around our playing roster are incredibly difficult ones to make and this decision is not made lightly with the absolute respect this club has for Benji Marshall. ‚ÄúWhile difficult however it is a decision that has been made as part of our constant roster management responsibilities in order to ensure clarity and certainty for our organisation moving forward. ‚ÄúWhatever Benji chooses to do in 2021 ‚Äî whether that is playing football or not ‚Äî will be up to him and I have no doubt he will be a success. ‚ÄúHe is a terrific player and person and will unequivocally have the full admiration and respect of this organisation in whatever he does next in life.‚Äù Marshall said in August he is still keen to play on again next season and has sought advice from legendary coach Wayne Bennett. headline: Inside Beyonce and Jay Z‚Äôs incredible $2.75 million-a-week superyacht
text: Beyonc√© and Jay Z have been cruising the waters of the Mediterranean on a $2.75 million-a-week superyacht. Want a peek inside? It‚Äôs The Latest with Bronte and Bucky as the pair recap the entertainment news that made headlines in 2020. The luxury yacht Lana. Picture: Grgo Jelavic/PIXSELL/Splash NewsSource:Media Mode Power couple Beyonc√© and Jay Z have been cruising the waters of the Mediterranean on board a $2.75 million-a-week superyacht. The stars who are estimated to be worth a combined $1.92 billion celebrated Beyonc√©‚Äôs 39th birthday aboard the incredible boat with their children Blue Ivy 8 and twins Rumi and Sir 3. The Sun reports Beyonce and Jay-Z were spotted doting on their kids off the coast of Cavtat Croatia. Jay-Z and Beyonce leave the luxury yacht Lana near Cavtat Croatia. Picture: Grgo Jelavic /Pixsell/Splash NewsSource:Media Mode They have been cruising around on the 106m long and 13m high luxurious yacht Lana for Beyonc√©‚Äôs week-long birthday bonanza holiday. Built by an Italian shipyard Lana is one of the most impressive superyachts on the water. Inside there are eight staterooms and one master suite each with an ensuite and decorated in an individual colour scheme. The luxury yacht Lana. Picture: Grgo Jelavic/PIXSELL/Splash NewsSource:Media Mode Now that‚Äôs a pretty yacht. Picture: www.imperial-yachts.comSource:Supplied Un-bey-lievable. Picture: www.imperial-yachts.comSource:Supplied Lana also has plenty of entertainment to keep her VIP guests occupied during their stay. There is a luxurious spa with treatment rooms to unwind and indulge a well-equipped gym with professional trainers a cinema room with an impressive audio system and an outdoor pool to savour sunny days. The superyacht also has a unique Beach Club and two folding terraces which offer all the state-of-the-art toys including jet skis wakeboards SEABOBs waterskis inflatable paddleboards and fishing equipment. Lana can also host up to 34 crew to make sure the Knowles-Carter clan has their every need catered to. Lana has a pool on board. Picture: www.imperial-yachts.comSource:Supplied The luxury yacht rented by Beyonce and Jay-Z. Picture: www.imperial-yachts.comSource:Supplied RELATED: The most ridiculous Beyonc√© conspiracy theories The Crazy In Love hitmakers headed out on one of Lana‚Äôs speed boats during the seven-day jaunt in Croatia with their youngest two children. The family protected themselves from coronavirus by wearing face masks when on dry land with Beyonc√©‚Äôs mask sporting a white-lined smile across it. The break came after Beyonc√© was recently spotted filming in the Hamptons and the release of her visual album Black is King on Disney+. The entertainer spoke about Black Is King in an interview with Good Morning America and revealed all the work that went into it. She said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a year in the making. I worked with a diverse group of very gifted directors actors and creatives from all over the world to reimagine the story of The Lion King. ‚ÄúThe narrative story unfolds through music videos fashion dance beautiful natural settings and raw new talent. ‚ÄúBut it all started in my backyard. So from my house to Johannesburg to Ghana to London to Belgium to the Grand Canyon. It was truly a journey to bring this film to life.‚Äù It was Beyonc√©‚Äôs first visual album since Lemonade in 2016 which topped many best albums list. headline: Burglar Jordan Constable threatened to make victim‚Äôs daughter ‚Äòdisappear‚Äô from jail
text: A court has been told a burglar threatened to make his victim‚Äôs ‚Äúbaby girl‚Äù disappear if he didn‚Äôt redact statements made to police.  A man and his wife were ‚Äòdevastated‚Äô by the robbery and threat against their pregnant daughter. Picture: SuppliedSource:News Regional Media A desperate burglar threatened to make his victim‚Äôs ‚Äúbaby girl‚Äù disappear if the man didn‚Äôt retract ‚Äúnegative‚Äù statements made to police.   But the plot backfired and Jordan Constable later pleaded guilty to an attempt to pervert the course of justice. He was spared jail for the crime and was instead ordered to serve a three-year-community corrections order in the County Court of Victoria on Thursday. The 36-year-old wrote a letter to a victim of his burglary and offered to pay him $10000 for positive statements and a return of goods. ‚ÄúI see how much you adore and love your baby girl ‚Ä¶ it would be hard as (a) father knowing you could prevent your daughter disappearing but did nothing or the wrong move instead of following orders and making a healthy 10k of which will help your retirement‚Äù the burglar wrote. Convicted burglar Jordan Constable wrote a letter threatening a man‚Äôs daughter and offering $10000 if he changed his statement.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt f**k this up ‚Äì for your baby girl‚Äôs sake.‚Äù The threatening letter was sent to the victim‚Äôs Hallam house in March last year while Constable was on remand for the burglary. He was later sentenced to 217 days jail and an 18-month community corrections order for the crime. ‚ÄúI really don‚Äôt care exactly what is said just retract all negative statements against Jordan all items returned as his possessions make a positive statement ‚Ä¶ you are covered by insurance so make sure you get IT DONE!!‚Äù Constable wrote. The threatening letter was signed ‚ÄúMr K‚Äù but a handwriting analysis found it matched another letter Constable wrote which he claimed was a diary entry. The man and his wife were ‚Äúdevastated‚Äù by the burglary and the threat against their pregnant daughter. ‚ÄúThe offender knows everything about us and has invaded every inch of our lives‚Äù the wife told the court. The couple asked their daughter to move interstate with her husband out of fear. The judge issued a stern warning to Constable before he sentenced him. The convicted burglar was at Fulham Correctional Centre when he mailed the threatening letter.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúI tell you now ‚Ä¶ You come back here having breached it and just bring your toothbrush you won‚Äôt need counsel. You‚Äôll go straight to jail‚Äù Judge Michael McInerney told the convicted burglar. Prosecutors wanted Constable jailed for the crime but the letter writer wanted to avoid going back behind bars. His defence lawyer Jonathan Brancato argued the letter was ‚Äúspontaneous‚Äù Constable had been recovering from a serious drug addiction and it came ‚Äúfrom a place of desperation‚Äù. Constable will be subject to random drug tests offender behaviour therapy 200 hours of community work as part of the order and was ordered to pay $3000 which was put on hold for 18 months. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let me down Mr Constable‚Äù the judge said. headline: Man drowns at Redleaf ocean pool
text: A man has died after he was pulled unconscious from a popular ocean pool in Sydney‚Äôs exclusive Double Bay area.  A man in his 70s has died after being pulled from a Sydney ocean pool unconscious on Thursday. Picture: MatrixSource:Matrix A man in his 70s has drowned at Redleaf ocean pool in Double Bay in Sydney‚Äôs eastern suburbs.  Emergency services were called to the scene on New South Head Rd just before 1pm on Thursday to reports a man had been pulled unconscious from the water. Five ambulance crews a rescue helicopter and police raced to the scene and began CPR in a desperate attempt to save the man. Unfortunately he could not be revived and died at the scene. Despite a dramatic attempt to revive him an elderly man died at Redleaf ocean pool in Double Bay on Thursday afternoon. Picture: MatrixSource:Matrix Photographs taken at the water show a massive crowd of health professionals desperately working to save the man as police rope off the area. Officers from Eastern Suburbs Local Area Command will prepare a report for the coroner. hannah.moore1@news.com.au The man was pulled from the water unconscious just before midday and five ambulance crews a rescue helicopter and police raced to the scene. headline: NSW Government divided as Nationals pull support boycott meetings over koala habitat policy
text: The NSW government is in turmoil and rebelling Nationals ministers have hours left to decide how to meet an ultimatum from the Premier. Sky News host Peter Gleeson says Annastacia Palaszczuk today demonstrated she is a "very poor premier" because instead of showing compassion and empathy she denied a young woman from being able to attend her father's funeral. A policy relating to koala habitat has caused division within the New South Wales Government. Picture: NCA NewsWire/Bianca De MarchiSource:News Corp Australia New South Wales Premier Gladys Berejiklian marched into a meeting of National Party frontbenchers on Thursday and told them she was ‚Äúdisgusted‚Äù demanding their resignations unless they agreed to withdraw a threat to move to the crossbench. Deputy Premier John Barilaro and the other Nationals in Ms Berejiklian‚Äôs Cabinet have until 9am on Friday morning to indicate whether they will remain in their roles or surrender them amid a dispute over koala policy. In a move that splintered the Coalition Mr Barilaro said on Thursday his party would not support government legislation and would boycott joint party room meetings and parliamentary leadership meetings.  He was taking a stand over amendments to the State Environmental Planning Policy (SEPP) which were designed to protect koala habitats. Ms Berejiklian slapped him down in an extraordinary public statement. ‚ÄúI have already made clear to the Deputy Premier that his policy concerns are listed for discussion at an upcoming Cabinet meeting and will be considered by the joint party room‚Äù the Premier said. ‚ÄúIt is long established convention that members of Cabinet must support government legislation. It is not possible to be the deputy premier or a Minister of the Crown and sit on the crossbench. ‚ÄúI am and always have been a strong Coalitionist and deeply respect the National Party and all it stands for. It is my strong preference that existing Coalition arrangements stay in place. ‚ÄúHowever I have just made it clear to the Deputy Premier that he and his Nationals colleagues who are members of the Cabinet have until 9am Friday to indicate to me whether they wish to remain in my Cabinet or else sit on the crossbench. They cannot do both. ‚ÄúIf required I will attend Government House tomorrow and swear in a new ministry.‚Äù Premier Gladys Berejiklian has issued an ultimatum to rebel Nationals MPs. Picture: NCA NewsWire/Flavio BrancaleoneSource:News Corp Australia According to Seven News reporter Alex Hart on Thursday afternoon Ms Berejiklian privately confronted a group of senior Nationals - Mr Barilaro Paul Toole Sarah Mitchell and Bronnie Taylor - with words ‚Äúto the effect‚Äù of: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been so disgusted in the three plus years working with you. Either you withdraw your threat or I want your resignations on my desk at 9am tomorrow.‚Äù The Telegraph later added more detail to that account. It reported the Premier called the National frontbenchers into her office at 4:30pm and the meeting lasted ‚Äúless than a minute‚Äù before she dismissed the group. Her office released the scathing media statement described above before they had even made it back to Mr Barilaro‚Äôs office. Mr Barilaro appeared on Sky News on Thursday evening where he was interviewed by former 2GB radio host Alan Jones. ‚ÄúI never thought I‚Äôd be part of a government that punishes people for standing up for what is right for their communities‚Äù the Deputy Premier said. ‚ÄúThe vindictive personal attack on me over the last few days either privately and quietly or publicly calling for me to resign ‚Äì I always find it amusing that whenever I stand for policy some Liberal members will ask me to resign because they don‚Äôt want to debate the policy. They always play the man not the ball and that‚Äôs what it feels like today.‚Äù Jones asked whether the conversation described by Hart and the Telegraph had indeed happened. ‚ÄúYeah look it was a very abrupt meeting. And she‚Äôs followed up with a statement‚Äù said Mr Barilaro. ‚ÄúLook it was an opportunity where we thought we could negotiate an outcome. And it wasn‚Äôt an option it was a threat that we have until 9am tomorrow to resign as ministers. If not the threat that she‚Äôll go to Government House sack us and install a new ministry.‚Äù He said the Nationals had held both a party room meeting and an executive meeting both of which reconfirmed his support. ‚ÄúI have the full support of the party room and the executive‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll meet again in the morning. We‚Äôre not going to rush to a decision right now. ‚ÄúThe thing I‚Äôm worried about is it‚Äôs very easy for me to give up the ministerial car. You know if this is about a title I‚Äôll give it up tomorrow. What worries me if National Party members aren‚Äôt party of the Cabinet there won‚Äôt be any outcomes for the regions. We have fought hard for everything.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going to happen tomorrow?‚Äù Jones asked. ‚ÄúWell I think the idea that we should lose our ministries because we‚Äôre fighting for our community is wrong‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúDo I confidently believe a Liberal-only Cabinet is going to deliver? So maybe we‚Äôve got to find a compromise where ministers will remain in the ministry we‚Äôll abide by the Cabinet solidarity and its rules. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to find a way forward and that means working out a compromise for everybody. ‚ÄúThis won‚Äôt be about backing down. I can hit a pause button for a second we‚Äôll work it out but at some point in the next two or three weeks we are going to have to confront the issue. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to blow up the government. I‚Äôm not going to walk away from our ministerial responsibilities but I know that while we‚Äôre at the table the regions win and that is something I‚Äôm not going to let go.‚Äù Deputy Premier John Barilaro has said the Nationals will not support government bills until the issue is resolved. Picture: AAP Image/Dean LewinsSource:AAP The new regulations class more trees as koala habitat which further restricts the clearing of land. Mr Barilaro said the policy was borne out of guilt that habitats were being destroyed in Sydney yet developments continue to be approved. He said the Nationals were concerned the property rights of landholders were being eroded through the policy. ‚ÄúTo cover that guilt here in Sydney we think that a SEPP like this is somehow a way to sanitise the regions attack the property rights of landholders do absolutely nothing to support koalas‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut what it does do it does impact on our communities our prosperity and our farmers. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not anti-koala.‚Äù He said the party room planned to introduce a repeal bill for the SEPP. The Nationals have 13 lower house MPs and six in the upper house. If Ms Berejiklian loses the support of the party the Liberals will hold a minority government. headline: Bitter war of words after Scott Morrison‚Äôs emotional interview
text: Scott Morrison was on the verge of tears when making an emotional plea to the Queensland Premier. Prime Minister Scott Morrison choked up with emotion on 2GB this morning with a powerful borders message for Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk. Prime Minister Scott Morrison made a plea for a woman to be able to attend her dad‚Äôs funeral.Source:AAP Scott Morrison has made a heartbreaking plea for the Queensland Premier to allow a 26-year-old daughter to attend her father‚Äôs funeral today during an emotional radio interview. But his dramatic intervention has now prompted Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk to claim the Prime Minister ‚Äúbullied‚Äù her during an extraordinary phone call. Canberran Sarah Caisip 26 remains in quarantine after she travelled to Queensland to spend time with her father during his final days but he died before she could get out. The Prime Minister confirmed this morning he had called Ms Palaszczuk and demanded she take action to allow the woman to skip quarantine so she can attend the funeral which is taking place this afternoon. Since that phone conversation Ms Caisip has been allowed to have a private viewing at the funeral home after the service but will not be allowed to attend the funeral. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve appealed to her to overrule the decision‚Äô‚Äô Mr Morrison told 4BC radio earlier today about his phone call with the Queensland Premier. ‚ÄúThat would allow Sarah to go to the funeral today. It‚Äôs not about borders. It‚Äôs not about politicians. It‚Äôs not about elections. The only thing that matters today is that Sarah can be with her 11-year-old sister Isobel and her mother while they mourn the passing of their father and husband Bernard at Mount Gravatt today.‚Äù Both Mr Morrison and radio broadcaster Ray Hadley were on the verge of tears during the emotional interview as they discussed their own father‚Äôs deaths. RELATED: Follow the latest coronavirus updates Sarah Caisip is fighting to leave hotel quarantine early to attend her dad‚Äôs funeral.Source:Channel 9 RELATED: Premier accuses PM of bullying her ‚ÄúSadly she wasn‚Äôt able to see her father before he passed. All of us who have been through that process know how important that is. It‚Äôs still fresh in my mind‚Äô‚Äô he said. Mr Morrison paused before becoming emotional again as he discussed the woman being in hotel quarantine on Father‚Äôs Day. ‚ÄúIt was Father‚Äôs Day on the weekend and I‚Äôm just thinking if Sarah had to go through that day in a hotel in isolation and there she is today‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSurely just this once this can be done. ‚ÄúThere have been no COVID cases in Canberra for 60 days. I‚Äôve done all I can.‚Äù ‚ÄúI just hope they change their mind. I hope they let Sarah go.‚Äù He said he hoped Queensland could provide ‚Äúhope‚Äù to one family that needed it.. But one Queensland Government source told news.com.au ‚ÄúHe wasn‚Äôt bloody crying when he rang the Premier and berated her‚Äô‚Äô he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not her call. It‚Äôs the chief health officer‚Äôs. The PM rang and said ‚ÄòYou will do this. She had to remind him it was R U OK? day‚Äô.‚Äù In Parliament the Queensland Premier accused the Prime Minister of bullying her over borders. ‚ÄúI will not be bullied nor will I by intimidated by the Prime Minister of this country‚Äù Ms Palaszczuk said ‚Äú(He) contacted me this morning ‚Ä¶ and I made it very clear to the fact that it was not my decision. ‚Äú(I made it clear) that I would pass his comments on to the chief health officer and it is her decision to make.‚Äù RELATED: Massive lockdown mistake revealed Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has hit back at the PM. Photo: NCA NewsWire / Dan PeledSource:News Corp Australia RELATED: Dying dad‚Äôs final wish rejected Ms Caisip has written a heartbreaking letter to the Queensland Premier after she was unable to cross the border to spend time with him during his final days. ‚ÄúMy dad is dead and you made me fight to see him but it was too late and now you won‚Äôt let me go to his funeral or see my devastated 11-year-old sister‚Äù Ms Caisip said. The woman who lives in the COVID-free ACT was wrestling with the Queensland Government to be allowed into the state in time to visit her dying father Bernard for what would be their final Father‚Äôs Day together. ‚ÄúYou won‚Äôt listen and your government is destroying my life‚Äù she said in her letter to Ms Palaszczuk. ‚ÄúNow you are preventing me from going to view his body which is a very important tradition for me and also preventing me from going to his funeral this Thursday even though I am in Brisbane in hotel quarantine and only a few kilometres away. ‚ÄúI came from virus-free Canberra so the fact that I‚Äôm even in quarantine is beyond belief but the fact that I am being denied my basic human rights to care for my grief-stricken mother and little 11-year-old sister enrages disgusts and devastates me at the same time. ‚ÄúMy little sister is now without my support and I will never forgive you ‚Äù Comments To join the conversation please Log in.
