headline: Public servants pulled from quarantine hotel inquiry told
text: Health and safety concerns prompted a government department to withdraw public servants from the hotel quarantine program an inquiry has been told. Rydges on Swanston hotel in Melbourne was part of the hotel quarantine program. Picture: NCA NewsWire/David GeraghtySource:News Corp Australia Public servants were pulled from overseeing hotel quarantine over health and safety fears an inquiry has been told. Ten authorised officers from the Department of Environment Land Water and Planning (DELWP) were seconded to the hotel program in late April at the request of the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS). The AOs had to check in detainees monitor their movements and escalate any quarantine breaches to police. However DELWP pulled them from the program after health and safety concerns put to the DHHS went unanswered the COVID-19 hotel quarantine inquiry was told. Concerns included inconsistencies between hotels and the lack of compulsory testing of detainees who were allowed to go for walks. The AOs also complained about a lack of job training insufficient rest between shifts and concerns security guards were walking through crowds of detainees then mixing with other staff while not wearing PPE and social distancing. DELWP chief conservation regulator Kate Gavens emailed the DHHS on June 24 about whether the concerns could be resolved. But when her email went unanswered she pulled her officers out of the program to be redirected elsewhere in the COVID-19 response. ‚ÄúThere were untested issues that could affect our remaining staff‚Äù she said in her statement. DHHS commander Murray Smith responsible for the AOs said he was aware they were no longer in the program but was unaware they had been withdrawn. ‚ÄúThere were a number of issues they raised‚Äù he told the inquiry. ‚ÄúThey had an interpretation I didn‚Äôt agree with but it was their interpretation.‚Äù Department of Health and Human Services commander Murray Smith gives evidence at the inquiry. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied  GUARDS TRIED TO KEEP SEX SECRET Two security guards who allegedly engaged in sexual activity while working in Melbourne‚Äôs hotel quarantine initially tried to keep their tryst secret the inquiry heard. A redacted email to MSS Security claims other guards discovered the amorous pair when they arrived to relieve them. ‚ÄúWhen they arrived on that level they are alleging that the two guards were taking part in some sort of sexual activity‚Äù the email says. The relieving guards tried to keep it a secret until an argument broke out after the guards in question complained about breaks. ‚ÄúThe relieving guards tried to keep it in-house between themselves and the guards but unfortunately things blew up tonight‚Äù the email continues. Other tendered documents reveal security guards sexually harassed and intimidated female colleagues at quarantine hotels. One complaint from a senior female staff member at Rydges said guards talked about nurses in a disrespectful manner. ‚ÄúI am absolutely tired of male security speaking in a manner that is condescending and rude to females here‚Äù a complaint read. ‚ÄúI have been told by some female staff directly that they have been asked rude and inappropriate questions and felt harassed. ‚ÄúQuestions like asking repeatedly what our Instagram names are comments like ‚ÄòYou have a nice voice are attractive‚Äô and being suggestive in the way they speak calling someone a princess when we tell them we have a boyfriend being intimidating demanding who we are and blocking us when we are just trying to enter our own workplace. ‚ÄúAt this time as females alone and surrounded by males that act in this way we don‚Äôt feel safe. ‚ÄúThis behaviour is unacceptable and none of us should come to work expecting to be harassed.‚Äù Victorian quarantine hotel inquiry counsel assisting Ben Ihle. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied DETAINEE DIED WHILE WELFARE STAFF WERE OVERRUN A male who took his own life while in hotel quarantine made at least five unanswered calls for help while welfare staff were overrun the inquiry was told. There was a delay of at least 24 hours before his last call and him being found Safer Care Victoria Professor Euan Wallace confirmed. He was only checked once during his nine-day detainment. A Safer Care Victoria review that followed found a welfare check team was unable to meet the planned schedule because there was not enough staff to match the workload. ‚ÄúAs a result initial welfare checks were often delayed and subsequent checks were often infrequent‚Äù the report shown to the inquiry by counsel assisting Ben Ihle said. Daily nurse calls were carried out for physical symptoms. But the backlog meant the first welfare check call for mental health symptoms of the male was not done until day five of his detainment. ‚ÄúIt was the only welfare check call made during the nine days of detainment before his death‚Äù the report found. Also it said it was not unusual for detainees not already known to be a high risk to receive their first welfare check call about day five to seven of their quarantine. Victorian quarantine hotel inquiry: Professor Euan Wallace. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied TRAVEL AGENCY WELFARE CHECKS A travel agency was involved in conducting welfare checks on returned travellers in quarantine the inquiry was told. Helloworld employees joined health department workers in conducting the checks via phone calls. Prof Wallace said the company was engaged by the health department to do them using prepared scripts. ‚ÄúAnd they do that very effectively‚Äù he said. He said he did not know what qualifications they had. A Safer Care Victoria review said welfare checks were done by phoning hotel rooms directly but they were transferred via hotel switchboard which was often overwhelmed so in some cases were not done. There was also confusion about which nurses were doing daily health checks at hotel sites and conflicts between security and nursing staff ‚Äì including a ‚Äústand-up verbal fight‚Äù over masks. The review also found public sector staff put themselves forward for temporary work in the quarantine program and were placed in positions without appropriate skills or knowledge. HOME DETENTION FOR RETURNED TRAVELLERS THOUGHT TOO RISKY Home detention for returned travellers was considered too risky the inquiry heard. DHHS deputy secretary Melissa Skilbeck admitted the idea was considered but it was believed people wouldn‚Äôt comply despite a $20000 fine for breaches. ‚ÄúIt was not progressed‚Äù Ms Skilbeck told inquiry chair Jennifer Coate. ‚ÄúThe public health risk was considered unacceptable.‚Äù Ms Skilbeck said there was a lot of commentary at that time about people breaching self-isolation. Coronavirus outbreaks at Melbourne‚Äôs Rydges on Swanston and Stamford Plaza Hotel where returned travellers were being quarantined led to 99 per cent of Victoria‚Äôs second wave of COVID-19 cases. Ms Skilbeck told counsel assisting Ben Ihle the spread of the virus from the quarantine hotels into the community was ‚Äúvery disappointing to us all‚Äù. ‚ÄúIt was a reminder it was not possible to have nil risk in the environment where coronavirus was.‚Äù Mr Ihle questioned why the public health aims of hotel quarantine failed. ‚ÄúIf there was something tangible to put our hats on we would‚Äôve acted upon it by now‚Äù Ms Skilbeck replied. ‚ÄúClearly it was contrary to the intent of everyone involved.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine: What triggered shutdown of vaccine hope
text: Australia‚Äôs hopes of an early virus vaccine have been put on hold after a woman in the clinical trial was diagnosed with a serious illness. Australia‚Äôs vaccine hopes have been dampened after a major setback in the human trials. The coronavirus vaccine race continues. Picture: Douglas Magno/AFPSource:AFP A participant in AstraZeneca‚Äôs coronavirus vaccine trial triggered a global shutdown of the promising vaccine after she experienced worrying neurological symptoms. The woman‚Äôs symptoms were consistent with transverse myelitis a serious spinal inflammatory disorder that can cause bladder problems muscle weakness pain and at worst paralysis. AstraZeneca chief executive Pascal Soriot revealed the woman‚Äôs symptoms in a private conference call with investors yesterday information that was later shared with health news site STAT. The woman had been taking part in phase three of AstraZeneca‚Äôs coronavirus vaccine trial in the UK when she began experiencing the symptoms. A colorised scanning electron micrograph of a cell (blue) heavily infected with SARS-CoV-2 virus particles (red) isolated from a patient sample. Picture: AFPSource:AFP Mr Soriot said while her diagnosis had not been confirmed yet she was improving and was due to be discharged from hospital this week. The woman had been injected with AstraZeneca‚Äôs vaccine not a placebo Mr Soriot added. RELATED: Follow our live coronavirus updates RELATED: Dying father told to choose which child to visit him in hospital Pascal Soriot chief executive officer of AstraZeneca. Picture: Simon Dawson/BloombergSource:Bloomberg This isn‚Äôt the first time the company‚Äôs vaccine trial has been halted due to the health of a participant. Mr Soriot confirmed the clinical trial was stopped in July after another participant experienced neurological symptoms. On further investigation though the participant was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis with health authorities deeming it unrelated to the coronavirus vaccine. Mr Soriot told the three private investors on the conference call that the company was taking the vaccine very seriously. ‚ÄúA vaccine that nobody wants to take is not very useful‚Äù Mr Soriot said. Following the call AstraZeneca issued a statement saying it was bringing in independent experts to discuss when the company can resume clinical trials ‚Äúso that we can continue our work at the earliest opportunity to provide this vaccine broadly equitably and at no profit during this pandemic‚Äù. AstraZeneca‚Äôs headquarters in Sydney. Picture: Bianca De Marchi/NCA NewsWireSource:News Corp Australia Australian health authorities have cautioned against pinning all hopes on a single vaccine. Dr Brian McNamee the chair of CSL ‚Äì the firm tasked with producing vaccines in Australia ‚Äì said the vaccine could face a lengthy delay if one arrives at all. ‚ÄúIf they had asked us we would have told them that drug development is a very complex thing‚Äù Dr McNamee told the Herald Sun. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt bank on a vaccine. I think the treatments are improving but we have to learn to live with COVID. We have to manage it.‚Äù However Dr McNamee said the company was ‚Äúcautiously optimistic‚Äù but warned of ‚Äúrisks‚Äù. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why at CSL we‚Äôve got two vaccines we could manufacture because the likelihood of both working is not high‚Äù he told the publication. Placing clinical holds on vaccine trials is not uncommon as pharmaceutical companies work to ensure the treatment is as safe as possible. ‚ÄúTo have a clinical hold as has been placed on AstraZeneca as of yesterday because of a single serious adverse event is not at all unprecedented‚Äù Francis Collins the director of the US National Institutes of Health told a senate panel yesterday. ‚ÄúThis certainly happens in any large-scale trial where you have tens of thousands of people invested in taking part. Some of them may get ill and you always have to try to figure out: Is that because of the vaccine or were they going to get that illness anyway?‚Äù Prime Minister Scott Morrison signed a Letter of Intent with AstraZeneca in August in the hopes the Oxford University-researched vaccine would be ready by early next year. The Letter of Intent covers vaccine development production in Australia and distribution with a formal agreement including the price of the vaccine to taxpayers to follow. ‚ÄúToday is a day of hope and Australia needs hope the world needs hope when it comes to this coronavirus‚Äù Mr Morrison said last month. ‚ÄúBut ‚Ä¶ there is no guarantee that this or any other vaccine will be successful which is why we are continuing our discussions with many parties around the world while backing our own researchers at the same time to find a vaccine.‚Äù Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Professor Peter Kelly meet with team members of the Analytical Laboratory at AstraZeneca on August 19 in Sydney. Picture: Lisa Maree Williams/Pool/Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images The AstraZeneca vaccine known as AZD1222 uses an adenovirus that carries a gene for one of the proteins in SARS-CoV-2 the virus that causes COVID-19. The vaccine is being developed by a team of scientists at Oxford Vaccine Group (Department of Paediatrics) and Oxford University‚Äôs Jenner Institute in the United Kingdom. The group developed the vaccine by taking a spike protein from SARS-CoV-2 and injecting this into an adenovirus that causes the common cold. It‚Äôs hoped that the spike protein will trigger an immune response when injected in humans and that the body will quickly recognise the pathogen if exposed again and respond. The adenovirus is yet to be used in an approved vaccine but has been tested in other experimental vaccines including an ebola vaccine. headline: Coronavirus NSW: Venues that have been hit by COVID-19 cases
text: There are more than 50 venues across NSW that have active COVID alerts in place with many residents told to immediately self-isolate. Authorities are hesitant to tighten restrictions in NSW but experts warn the state's COVID numbers could rise exponentially. Multiple venues have been hit by COVID-19 cases across NSW.Source:Supplied There are now 51 venues across NSW that have active COVID-19 health alerts in place with many residents forced into self-isolation. One of the latest venues to be hit by coronavirus cases is the Eastern Suburbs Legion Club at Waverley. Of the seven new COVID-19 cases confirmed in NSW on Thursday two visited the Legion Club with a case reported the day before attending the club. One of the three cases attended the club on multiple occasions while infectious with NSW Health working to identify members who attended the venue at the same times. Contact tracing and investigations into the source of the original infection are under way. RELATED: Follow our latest coronavirus updates Picture: Eastern Suburbs Legion Club/FacebookSource:Facebook Anyone who attended the Legion Club on these days and times must immediately get tested and isolate for 14 days regardless of the result: ‚Ä¢ September 1 from 6pm ‚Ä¢ September 4 from 4.30pm ‚Ä¢ September 5 from 4.15pm ‚Ä¢ September 6 from 5pm ‚Ä¢ September 7 from 3pm ‚ÄúNSW Health is investigating whether someone at the club on the evening of Friday 28 August may be the source for cases associated with the club‚Äù NSW Health said in a statement. ‚ÄúNo known cases were infectious while at the club that evening however anyone who attended the Legion Club between 5pm and 6.30pm on Friday 28 August must immediately get tested and isolate until they receive a negative result.‚Äù There are 14 venues with ‚Äòclose contact‚Äô alerts in place meaning people who attending at particular times must immediately go into self-isolation for 14 days from their visit. headline: Illegal immigrant removed from quarantine hotel by officers in Hazmat suits
text: A group of Border Force officers in Hazmat suits have dramatically escorted a man from hotel quarantine after realising he wasn‚Äôt supposed to be in Australia. Hotel Quarantine Inquiry hears that the lessons learned during the coronavirus outbreak at the Rydges Hotel were applied to the outbreak at the Stamford Plaza Hotel outbreak limiting the spread of the disease Intercontinental Perth. Picture: IHGSource:Supplied An illegal immigrant has been escorted from a Perth quarantine hotel after border force officials realised he wasn‚Äôt even supposed to be in Australia. The man had been staying at the Intercontinental in the centre of Perth until yesterday afternoon before three officers dressed in Hazmat suits removed him from his room. The Intercontinental is being used by the West Australian government for its ‚Äúhigh risk‚Äù returned travellers or those deemed a flight risk. Australian Border Force (ABF) confirmed the man had spent the night in ABF custody and will be deported from the country. The Intercontinental Perth is being used for hotel quarantine.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúThe Australian Border Force can confirm a man who travelled to Western Australia from interstate and was in hotel quarantine in Perth has been detained as an unlawful non-citizen‚Äù a spokesperson said. ‚ÄúNon-citizens who do not hold a valid visa and who do not have a lawful basis for remaining in Australia will be liable for detention and removal from Australia as soon as practicable pending resolution of any ongoing matters.‚Äù Photos taken from outside the hotel obtained by The West showed the three suited-up officers removing the man. A West Australian police officer walked close behind while the man wearing a face shield walked in the middle of the group. It‚Äôs understood the man flew into Perth on Monday from Sydney and was immediately taken into hotel quarantine at the Intercontinental. After further investigation officers discovered the man had made it into Perth without a travel exemption. That investigation then revealed the man had managed to enter Australia illegally and did not have a visa. The officers acted swiftly and removed him from the hotel yesterday. Intercontinental Perth. Picture: IHGSource:Supplied Western Australia has had some of the strictest border measures in Australia since the coronavirus pandemic hit. Australian Defence Force members have been assisting West Australian Police and private security firms in hotel quarantine. Last month West Australian Premier Mark McGowan said the ADF had been added for extra security. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just about another layer of security it‚Äôs another layer of protection‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs mainly an introduction role in the foyers and the outside areas of the hotels so when people arrive to go into quarantine the ADF is there to greet them.‚Äù The Intercontinental is Perth‚Äôs high-security hotel with extra police and extra security to ensure no-one is able to leave their rooms for the mandated two weeks. headline: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson wants daily ‚Äòmoonshot‚Äô COVID testing
text: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson wants to roll out a new rapid pregnancy-style COVID test that could give his citizens ‚Äúfreedom to mingle‚Äù. Where did Britain go wrong in the battle against COVID-19? British Prime Minister Boris Johnson is hoping to get a ‚Äòfreedom passport‚Äô system up and running in his country. Picture: Stefan Rousseau/WPA Pool/Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images British Prime Minister Boris Johnson wants to roll out rapid pregnancy-style COVID tests to provide a ‚Äúfreedom passport‚Äù for Christmas parties and mass events. The only problem is that nobody knows yet if the tests which are designed to deliver a result in 15 minutes will actually work. As Britain battles a surge in cases that has sparked fears the entire country could face a second lockdown the ‚Äúmoonshot‚Äù option has been raised as a method to allow COVID-free citizens to return to work and normal life. Mr Johnson who barely survived his own bout of COVID-19 earlier this year that left him fighting for his life in intensive care outlined the ‚Äúfreedom passport‚Äù plan in London on Thursday. He predicted the mass testing could deliver millions of Londoners the ‚Äúfreedom to mingle‚Äù if they don‚Äôt have COVID. ‚ÄúI talked just now about how you could do that. Through that moonshot of daily testing ‚Äì everybody gets a pregnancy-style test a rapid turnaround test in the morning 15 minutes later you know whether you are infectious or not. ‚ÄúYou may not know whether you are infected or not but you know whether you are infectious or not and that gives you a kind of passport a freedom to mingle with everybody else who is similarly not infectious in a way that is currently impossible. ‚ÄúWe are aiming for that. We are driving for that. As I have said ‚Ä¶ we cannot be 100 per cent sure that we can deliver that in its entirety.‚Äù RELATED: Follow our live coronavirus coverage British Prime Minister Boris Johnson is hoping to get a ‚Äòfreedom passport‚Äô system up and running inthe UK. Picture: Stefan Rousseau/WPA Pool/Getty ImagesSource:AFP On Sunday the UK confirmed 2988 new coronavirus cases ‚Äì the highest number since May 23. Mr Johnson held his first coronavirus press briefing in six weeks on Thursday confirming tough new rules on gatherings that limit people to a group of just six inside and outside. The rules even apply to gyms. That‚Äôs left many wondering what sort of Christmas larger families face who cannot welcome relatives without breaking the law. During the press briefing ITV journalist Robert Peston questioned what happens if the rule of six is still in place by Christmas. ‚ÄúIs Christmas now effectively cancelled?‚Äô‚Äô he asked. Mr Johnson defended the new rules being put in place ‚Äúto prevent another wholesale national lockdown‚Äù. ‚ÄúWhether we are going to get things back to normal at all by Christmas I‚Äôm still hopeful as I‚Äôve said before that in many ways we could be able to get some aspects of our lives back to normal by Christmas‚Äô‚Äô Mr Johnson said. Authorities are concerned as winter approaches that COVID-19 infections could spike again in Britain. RELATED: Countries that have seen zero virus cases Infections in the UK are spiking again. Picture: Andrew Milligan/AFPSource:AFP The rules on gatherings represent the biggest reversal of the relaxation of restrictions in the UK this year. ‚ÄúYou must not meet socially in groups of more than six‚Äô‚Äô Mr Johnson said. ‚ÄúAnd if you do you will be breaking the law.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe ban will be set out in law and it will be enforced by the police ‚Äì anyone breaking the rules risks being dispersed fined and possibly arrested. ‚ÄúThe reason that we‚Äôre doing this as I said earlier on is to prevent another wholesale national lockdown of the kind that we had in March. That is the objective‚Äô‚Äô he said. Labour leader Keir Starmer said the new restrictions were a sign that the British Government had lost control of the virus battle. ‚ÄúI think the government‚Äôs now acknowledged that their poor communications were a large part of the problem so that‚Äôs got to be fixed‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut we support the principle of the measures and we ask everybody to follow those rules.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: Two arrested after Trump supporters Proud Boys clash with far-left demonstrators at Oregon State Capitol
text: A member of the far-right Proud Boys group has been filmed brutally bashing a protester with a bat before another woman maces the man on the ground. At least two people were arrested after Trump supporters travelling from the Portland suburbs clashed with far-left counter-protesters outside the Oregon State Capitol in Salem. A member of the Proud Boys is arrested by Oregon police after allegedly attacking Antifa protesters in Salem Oregon on September 7. Picture: Allison Dinner/AFPSource:AFP WARNING: Graphic language At least two people were arrested on Monday after Trump supporters travelling from the Portland suburbs clashed with far-left counter-protesters outside the Oregon State Capitol in Salem. Ty Parker 53 of Durango Colorado was arrested on suspicion of misdemeanour assault and first-degree intimidation. Trenton Wolfskill 37 of Eugene Oregon was arrested on suspicion of misdemeanour assault The Oregonian reported citing an Oregon State Police spokesperson. Both have since been released. Videos posted on social media showed several dozen people wearing military fatigues pro-Trump T-shirts and bearing clothing and flags labelled with the names of the far-right groups Patriot Prayer and the Proud Boys gathered on the steps of the Oregon State Capitol building in Salem Oregon. Several in the group later rushed toward a slightly smaller group of counter-protesters. One man in a bulletproof vest beat a counter-protester with what appeared to be a baseball bat knocking him to the ground. A woman then doused the fallen counter-protester with pepper spray. Another video showed a group wearing military fatigues and carrying an American flag rush toward a counter-protester knocking him to the ground and punching him before yelling gay slurs. Proud boy chases down another BLM  supporter beats them down. Police make arrests pic.twitter.com/J9YlhpoRnO Proud boys and BLM across the street from each other pic.twitter.com/A2MWmNjaMR Uniformed officers with the Salem Police Department and the Oregon State Police swiftly intervened and handcuffed the perpetrators. Earlier on Labor Day about a thousand people attended an ‚ÄúOregon For Trump 2020 Labor Day Cruise Rally‚Äù in the Clackamas Community College parking lot in Oregon City. The rally held about 30 minutes outside Portland was organised to show support for Mr Trump and federal and local law enforcement as Portland experiences three consecutive months of violent far-left demonstrations since the May 25 death of George Floyd while in police custody in Minneapolis. Some people attending the rally wore shirts bearing the name Jay Danielson a Patriot Prayer member who was shot and killed in Portland a week ago during violent protests. A Proud Boys member being arrested by police. Picture: Allison Dinner/AFPSource:AFP Members of Antifa stand with a shield and paintball gun in the street. Picture: Allison Dinner/AFPSource:AFP The suspected gunman Michael Forest Reinoehl was allegedly linked to the far-left group Antifa and appeared to target Mr Danielson law enforcement said after reviewing surveillance footage. Reinoehl was killed by a federal fugitive task force after allegedly drawing a gun on arresting officers. After listening to speakers at the rally on Monday morning several hundred cars trucks SUVs and tractors hoisted MAGA flags and blasted ‚ÄúGod Bless the USA‚Äù while driving down the highway in the direction toward Portland. In light of Mr Danielson‚Äôs death the caravan was directed not to enter Multnomah County where Portland is located in order ‚Äúto help keep everyone safe‚Äù according to the Facebook event page. Still several dozen continued past the Woodburn exit on Interstate 5 and into Salem to attend a second rally where Trump supporters in red MAGA hats unfolded a large American flag on the steps of the Capitol The Oregonian reported. Some members of the Proud Boys were reportedly seen armed with guns baseball bats sticks and pipes before rushing toward counter-protesters also firing paintballs at them. One video showed the group chanting ‚ÄúF**k Antifa‚Äù. It was unclear if the counter-protesters in Salem standing across from the group were armed. Around the same time in Portland on Monday hundreds of Black Lives Matter supporters rallied in Cathedral Park and demonstrated peacefully on the 102nd consecutive day of protests in the city KOIN-TV reported. The family-friendly event came hours after about 15 protesters were arrested in another area of Portland during demonstrations on Sunday night into Monday morning that left a fire burning outside a police precinct in the north side of the city. A crowd gathered outside the North Precinct Community Policing Center and began chanting ‚Äúburn it down‚Äù as some in the group lit a mattress on fire the Associated Press reported. Officials warned demonstrators against entering the precinct property saying they would be trespassing and subject to arrest. Charges for the 15 arrested included interfering with an officer resisting arrest reckless burning and possession of a destructive device. headline: Teacher accused of child sex claims Google search was for ‚Äòfilm name‚Äô
text: A teacher accused of meeting up with a 15-year-old boy to have sex has told a jury why she searched ‚Äúalibi‚Äù and ‚Äúsecluded areas‚Äù online. The factors driving teachers to engage in sexual relationships with their students. Teacher Kandice Barber 35 arrives is accused of engaging in illegal sexual activity with a 15-year-old boy. Picture: Jonathan Brady/PA Images via Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images A teacher accused of having sex with a schoolboy has told a court she only googled the word ‚Äúalibi‚Äù to find the name of the film Fatal Attraction. Married woman Kandice Barber 35 is on trial for alleged sexual acts with the 15-year-old who was a pupil at the Buckinghamshire school in South West England where she worked. Kandice Barber. Picture: Hyde News & PicturesSource:Supplied On Tuesday a jury heard on September 30 2018 she searched ‚Äúwhat is the name of someone you are having an affair with?‚Äù and the word ‚Äúalibi‚Äù before googling seconds later ‚Äúwhen you have a plan of where you have been‚Äù. The next day the defendant is said to have searched ‚Äúa lie of where you have been‚Äù before later looking up ‚Äúgood secluded areas‚Äù and ‚ÄúHoliday Inn Wycombe.‚Äù The Google searches were allegedly made in September and October 2018. Picture: Jonathan Brady/PA Images via Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images In the witness box Ms Barber gave her explanation for her actions. She said: ‚ÄúI was up at 5am as my mum and I were going to set up a car boot sale. ‚ÄúOn the way there was a name of a film that was bugging me so I googled those words. We were trying to remember the film name. ‚ÄúI thought the name had something to do with adultery but it turned out to be the film Fatal Attraction.‚Äù She added that she had googled the hotel for her son‚Äôs father to stay in while he visited and ‚Äúgood secluded areas‚Äù was in relation to wanting to take her dog for a walk off the lead as he ‚Äúabsolutely loves lakes‚Äù. Fatal Attraction movie poster. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied Ms Barber is accused of meeting up with the pupil for sex on three occasions late in 2018 in a field in woodland and in her 4WD. After rumours about the pair‚Äôs relationship spread she was arrested at school and claimed the allegations were complete fiction the jury heard. At Aylesbury Crown Court Judge Francis Sheridan said to Ms Barber although the boy had called her three times the majority of phone calls had been started by her. She replied: ‚ÄúA lot of the time I am calling because he has contacted me on Snapchat saying ‚Äòcall me call me‚Äô. ‚ÄúNow I think he was clearly infatuated and obsessed with me. For me it was all perfectly innocent conversation.‚Äù Aylesbury Crown Court in Buckinghamshire. Picture: Jonathan Brady/PA Images via Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images The court heard Ms Barber had begged the boy to delete the messages between them following rumours that had floated around in school and at a meeting with the head teacher. She said: ‚ÄúAt one point I asked the boy to delete messages between us because I was concerned about losing my job. ‚ÄúMy eldest son had got wind of the rumours he is the type of person who would ask to see my phone.‚Äù She is currently on trial. Picture: Jonathan Brady/PA Images via Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images Kandice Barber‚Äôs husband Daniel Barber. Picture: Hyde News & PicturesSource:Supplied Prosecutor Richard Milne questioned ‚ÄúHe has gone to all this trouble to create a fictitious relationship between the two of you. He has messaged himself to create this fantasy relationship with you?‚Äù The 35-year-old of Wendover in England denies three counts of causing or inciting a child aged under 16 to engage in a sexual act and one count of sexual communication with a child. She further denies one count of causing or inciting a child to engage in sexual activities while in a position of trust and one count of causing a child to watch a sexual act by a person in a position of trust. Her husband Daniel Barber is expected to give evidence later in the trial. headline: Afghanistan fast bowler pulls off controversial mankad
text: We hope Ricky Ponting wasn‚Äôt watching cricket in Afghanistan when a fast bowler pulled off a dirty deed to grab a vital wicket. Cricket: The cricket world has again been left divided after a controversial act of sportsmanship during Sunday night's loss to South Africa in the Women's Twenty20 World Cup. Bowlers are taking back the power.Source:Twitter Mankads have made their way to Afghanistan. Fast bowler Dawlat Zadran pulled off the controversial move to run out Noor Ali Zadran during a T20 match in the Shpageeza League in the capital city of Kabul. Watch every ball of Australia‚Äôs Tour of England Live & On-Demand on Kayo. New to Kayo? Get your free trial now & start streaming instantly > The Kabul Eagles were chasing 164 for victory when Zadran wandered out of his crease at the non-striker‚Äôs end in the 16th over and paid the ultimate price. Running in to bowl Dawlat noticed Zadran had gone AWOL and whipped the bails off before delivering the ball. After the match Afghanistan captain Farhan Zakhil said the act was not ‚Äúin the spirit of the game‚Äù. Mankading is the most divisive move in cricket and while technically not illegal is frowned upon by many. It refers to the bowler running out the batter at the non-striker‚Äôs end before delivering the ball if they notice the willow-wielder has backed-up too far and left their crease. The dismissal üëápic.twitter.com/PwQXjROR0E We‚Äôre not sure how much former Australian captain Ricky Ponting watches of the Shpageeza League but if he caught the incident he won‚Äôt have liked what he saw. Last month the cricket legend reiterated he‚Äôs no fan of Mankading ‚Äî and will tell Indian star Ravi Ashwin as much when he coaches the off-spinner at the Delhi Capitals at this year‚Äôs Indian Premier League (IPL). Ashwin is an advocate of the Mankad sparking huge controversy in last year‚Äôs IPL by dismissing England‚Äôs Jos Buttler in that fashion and has been vocal ever since about bowlers having the right to take such action to stop batters gaining an unfair advantage by walking down the pitch before setting off for a run. But Ponting won‚Äôt tolerate that in his team. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be having a chat with him about (Mankading) that‚Äôs the first thing I‚Äôll do‚Äù Ponting said on The Grade Cricketer podcast. ‚ÄúObviously he wasn‚Äôt in our squad last year he‚Äôs one of our players that we tried to afford to bring in this year. ‚ÄúLook he‚Äôs a terrific bowler and he‚Äôs done a great job in the IPL for a long period of time now but I must admit watching that last season as soon as it happened and he did that I actually sat our boys down and said ‚ÄòLook I know he‚Äôs done it there‚Äôll be others around the tournament who‚Äôll think about doing this as well but that‚Äôs not going to be the way that we play our cricket. We won‚Äôt be doing that‚Äô. RELATED: Optical illusion in dicey Smith moment RELATED: Have Aussies found their missing T20 link? Ravi Ashwin makes no apologies about his actions.Source:Supplied ‚ÄúSo that‚Äôs going to be a conversation and that‚Äôs going to be a hard conversation I will have to have with him but I‚Äôm pretty sure he‚Äôll take it on the chin. ‚ÄúI think even him looking back now probably he‚Äôd say it was within the rules and he‚Äôs right to do it but this is not within the spirit of the game not in the way I want at least with the Delhi Capitals anyway.‚Äù Ponting would rather see teams cop a runs penalty if batters at the non-striker‚Äôs end are guilty of leaving their crease early. He believes that would discourage the practice and at the same time eliminate the need for bowlers to take action into their own hands. headline: Kool & The Gang co-founder Ronald ‚ÄòKhalis‚Äô Bell dies aged 68
text: Ronald ‚ÄúKhalis‚Äù Bell who co-founded funk and R&B pioneers Kool & The Gang has died aged 68. Kool & The Gang. Picture: Ebet Roberts/RedfernsSource:Getty Images The man who famously wrote iconic songs such as Celebration and Jungle Boogie has died. Ronald ‚ÄúKhalis‚Äù Bell who co-founded funk and R&B pioneers Kool & The Gang was 68. The band‚Äôs publicist said Bell died in his Virgin Islands home with his wife by his side but no cause has been given. Bell started the group with his brother Robert ‚ÄúKool‚Äù Bell along with neighbourhood friends Dennis ‚ÄúD.T.‚Äù Thomas Robert ‚ÄúSpike‚Äù Mickens Charles Smith George Brown and Ricky West. Ronald Bell of Kool & The Gang has died aged 68. Picture: Carrasquillo/Getty ImagesSource:Getty Images He wrote some of the group‚Äôs biggest hits including Jungle Boogie Celebration and Get Down On It with James Taylor. Celebration was a US number one hit for the band and was inspired by Bell‚Äôs Islamic faith. Kool & The Gang won two Grammy Awards one or their work on the soundtrack to Saturday Night Fever. Recently Bell had been working on a series of collaborations including a solo endeavour ‚ÄúKool Baby Brotha Band‚Äù. He also had plans of putting together a series of animated shorts called ‚ÄúKool TV‚Äù about their childhood and career. He is survived by 10 children. headline: Dominic Thiem thrashes Alex de Minaur in US Open quarter-finals
text: Alex de Minaur‚Äôs US Open dream is over after being hammered in straight sets by Dominic Thiem the favourite to win the grand slam. Tennis: Aussie Alex De Minaur has made it through to his first ever Major Quarter Final after a straight sets victory in the US Open Round of 16. Alex de Minaur was no match for Dominic Thiem.Source:AFP Dominic Thiem has brushed off Aussie tennis star Alex de Minaur in straight sets to advance to the US Open semi-finals. World No. 3 Thiem was on another level to his young opponent as he eased to a 6-1 6-2 6-4 win on Arthur Ashe Stadium. Watch LIVE coverage of the US Open from the opening round to the finals with ESPN on Kayo. New to Kayo? Get your 14-day free trial & start streaming instantly > With Novak Djokovic out of the tournament after being disqualified for hitting a lineswoman in the throat with a ball earlier this week Thiem will like his chances of winning his maiden grand slam title after finishing runner-up in his three previous major finals. In his first ever grand slam quarter-final de Minaur struggled on serve all match and was never able to put Thiem under any pressure. The 21-year-old Aussie showed plenty of his trademark fight ‚Äî particularly in the third set when he bounced back from 1-3 down to 4-3 up ‚Äî but it was too little too late for the world No. 28. Thiem held a lengthy game for 4-4 then broke quickly to make it 5-4 before keeping cool and serving out the match. RELATED: Disbelief at Aussie‚Äôs US Open interview RELATED: Women in Novak‚Äôs life reveal grave fears De Minaur can still hold his head high after exiting the tournament.Source:AFP Dominic Thiem was a class above.Source:AFP Despite the defeat De Minaur didn‚Äôt lose any fans. Late in the third set British tennis writer George Bellshaw tweeted: ‚ÄúThe athleticism on show in this match is phenomenal. Both so quick such excellent movers around the court.‚Äù Journalist Joe Krishnan said some of Thiem‚Äôs efforts were ‚Äúabsurd‚Äù while The Tennis Podcast‚Äôs official Twitter account called the Austrian‚Äôs level of play ‚Äúrude‚Äù it was that good. Thiem will face Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals after the Russian outclassed countryman Andrey Rublev in straight sets earlier on Thursday. The other semi sees Alexander Zverev face Pablo Carreno Busta. Djokovic‚Äôs default means we will have a debut major winner for the first time since Marin Cilic in 2014. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no Roger (Federer) Rafa (Nadal) Novak but there is Daniil Sascha (Zverev) and Pablo now‚Äù Thiem said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre three amazing players. ‚ÄúEvery single one of us deserves this first major title everybody will give it all. Once we step on the court the other three are forgotten anyway.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: A Russian Playboy model has drowned during a photo shoot in the Mediterranean
text: A photographer is being questioned by police after a Russian model was found dead by coastguards during a photo shoot in the Mediterranean. A British photographer has been probed by police after Russian Playboy model Galina Fedorova 32 (pictured) was found dead by coastguards while she was on a photo shoot.Source:Supplied A British photographer has been questioned by police after a Russian model drowned during a photo shoot in the Mediterranean. Playboy centrefold Galina Fedorova 32 was found dead by coastguards after apparently going for a swim with photographer Yev Taranovs. The pair were heading to a remote Sardinian island on a hired inflatable boat for an assignment when Taranovs said they stopped and went for a dip The Sun reports. RELATED: Model‚Äôs loss ‚Äòjust like Charlotte Dawson‚Äô British photographer Yev Taranovs has been questioned by police over the death of Playboy model Galina Fedorova 32. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied But the boat littered with alcohol bottles broke from its anchor and beached on a nearby reef at Isola Rossa off the Sardinian southeast coast. Taranovs told Italian police they tried to swim for the boat but he then lost sight of Galina and shouted for help to a nearby vessel. He was taken to Sardinia while a chopper found Galina lifeless in the water. Police also seized a drone used for the photo shoot. RELATED: Boy in custody after body found in bin The pair were heading to a remote Sardinian island on a hired inflatable boat for an assignment when Taranovs said they stopped and went for a dip. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied ‚ÄúThere is interest in the drone footage as this happened very close to a NATO firing range. We have to make sure the assignment was not a cover for a spying mission‚Äù a police spokeswoman said. Taranovs 42 from Twickenham south west London had earlier posted on Instagram about his trip to ‚Äúparadise‚Äù. There is also a video of him steering a boat at speed with the caption: ‚ÄúA sailor went to sea sea sea‚Äù. Galina was found lifeless by coastguards after Yev was picked up from the sea by a passing boat and taken to shore. Picture: Instagram/galinamodelSource:Supplied Taranovs told Italian police they tried to swim for the boat but he then lost sight of Galina and shouted for help to a nearby vessel. Picture: Instagram/galinamodelSource:Supplied A post-mortem on Galina found she drowned. Picture: Instagram/galinamodelSource:Supplied Paris-based Galina described herself as a ‚Äúmodel traveller yoga lover hedonist and earth patriot‚Äù. On her last Instagram post a follower had broke the news writing ‚ÄúSorry to say but Galina got into an accident in Italy and it didn‚Äôt end well‚Äù. Taranovs was treated for shock after last Saturday‚Äôs tragedy. A post-mortem on Galina found she drowned. Paris-based Galina described herself as a ‚Äòmodel traveller yoga lover hedonist and earth patriot‚Äô. Picture: Instagram/galinamodelSource:Supplied ‚ÄúThe current took the boat towards the reef and they tried to swim towards it but were unable to reach it‚Äù the police spokeswoman said. She said the male survivor has been questioned adding: ‚ÄúBottles of alcohol were found on the boat‚Äù. The Foreign Office said it was ‚Äúoffering advice and support to a British man in Sardinia‚Äù. headline: YouTube stars have ‚Äòbiggest gender reveal ever‚Äô at Burj Khalifa
text: A YouTube star dropped a huge amount of cash hosting the ‚Äúbiggest gender reveal ever‚Äù ‚Äì but while fans loved it others aren‚Äôt impressed. An influencer based in Dubai has taken his baby‚Äôs gender reveal to the next-level ‚Äì lighting up the city‚Äôs famous Burj Khalifa to announce he‚Äôs having a baby boy. YouTube stars have ‚Äòbiggest gender reveal ever‚Äô. Picture: YouTubeSource:Instagram Gender reveals have been getting out of hand lately.  One involving fireworks in LA sparked a massive wildfire on the weekend that is still continuing to blaze through the San Bernardino National Forest in California. While other lavish affairs involving confetti guns and wild car rides have also gone horribly wrong fatally injuring guests and ending in dangerous explosions. But none of that has stopped a famous YouTube family in their quest to have the ‚Äúbiggest gender reveal ever‚Äù. Anas Marwah a Syrian-Canadian YouTube star with 7.5 million followers has gone viral after sharing his next-level gender reveal. The social media influencer lives in the notoriously opulent (and somewhat excessive) Dubai with his wife Aayla and daughter Mila. And the family decided to light up the city‚Äôs iconic Burj Khalifa when it cam to revealing the sex of their impending second child. The skyscraper is no regular building ‚Äì it is in fact the world‚Äôs tallest standing at 829.8m with a staggering 163 floors. A video shared just hours ago on Anas‚Äô Instagram shows the extremely extra gender reveal in all its glory ‚Äì and already it has been viewed nearly a million times. RELATED: Why gender reveals are dumb new tradition YouTube star Anas Marwah reportedly spent $130000 on the gender reveal. Picture: YouTubeSource:YouTube The Burj Khalifa flashed a variety of pink and blue in the build-up to the big moment ‚Äì including a silhouette of the couple ‚Äì before a 10-second countdown flashed up on the side of the building. When it reached zero a pink line and a blue line wiggled all the way up to the peak of the building‚Äôs spire then turned blue and read: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a boy.‚Äù The clip then pans to the excited parents who are clutching two-year-old Mila throughout and shows them jumping for joy. TheDubai‚Äôs Burj Khalifa lit up blue to celebrate the couple‚Äôs second child. Picture: YouTubeSource:YouTube An extended 15-minute video of the showstopping stunt has also been shared on Anas‚Äô YouTube account which shows him and Aayla dressing up for the occasion. Aayla wore a white gown embellished with feathers and sequins while Anas wore a casual checked grey suit. Both wore face masks to match their outfits. Reaction to the lavish celebration has been huge with the couple‚Äôs YouTube video being viewed almost 10 million times in the last 24 hours and receiving almost 200000 comments. Some written in Arabic and roughly translated wished the couple congratulations and labelled it the ‚Äúmost beautiful video‚Äù. But not everyone was impressed by the extravagant affair. Picture: YouTubeSource:Instagram However on Twitter users have branded it ‚Äúnauseating ridiculousness‚Äù claiming the pair spent 350000 United Arab Emirates Dirham which is roughly $130000. More on the nauseating ridiculousness of gender reveals I give you this 350000 Dhms ~ 100K USD gender reveal in Dubai. I am ashamed for them but it seems they have no shame. I pity the children...https://t.co/A0TwbHD7Ge I agree. However this is all a publicity stunt. 1. Its ranked the biggest gender reveal ever made till now. 2. The money he paid he‚Äôll get them back easily through the views shares and controversy it all created. So I‚Äôm pretty sure they couldn‚Äôt care less üòÇ This Arab couple paid $100000 for a gender reveal to be revealed in Dubais famous buildings burj khalifa. How stupid are humans now a days? Instead of spending that much for 10 seconds of your time could have used that money to donate to the Middle East. Someone did a gender reveal on the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. Cost 350 grand or so they say. Gammiest looking thing I‚Äôve ever seen. pic.twitter.com/Z93GpNMWRJ did i just see a gender reveal...on the burj khalifa???? I was gonna make a comment about that burj khalifa gender reveal but it‚Äôs so disgusting tone deaf and full of opportunists that I decided it wasn‚Äôt worth my energy Would you spend $130000 on a gender reveal party? headline: ‚ÄòHuman Ken Doll‚Äô Jessica Alves shares photos after botched chin filler
text: Jessica Alves known as the ‚ÄúHuman Ken Doll‚Äù has had over 100 cosmetic procedures ‚Äì but the latest resulted in a ‚Äúvery bad‚Äù hole in her face. Ken Doll' is left with a hole in her chin as product 'pours out'. Jessica Alves also known as the ‚ÄòHuman Ken Doll‚Äô revealed on Tuesday she was left with hole in her chin following a botched filler job. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram Jessica Alves also known as the ‚ÄúHuman Ken Doll‚Äù has taken to Instagram to reveal her cosmetic procedure horror which left her with a hole in her chin. Since the age of 17 the transgender Brazilian-British TV star who lives in London has had more than 100 cosmetic procedures costing roughly $1 million. And while she admitted to ‚Äúlearning her lesson‚Äù following previous botched jobs the 37-year-old insisted on having more filler injected into her face this time by a trainee. RELATED: Harrowing life of ‚ÄòHuman Ken doll‚Äô Jessica Alves also known as the ‚ÄòHuman Ken Doll‚Äô revealed on Tuesday she was left with hole in her chin following a botched filler job. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram She said product has been ‚Äòpouring out of her chin‚Äô following the procedure at a hair salon in Essex UK. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram RELATED: ‚ÄòKen doll‚Äô undergoes $54000 bum augmentation ‚ÄúNot long (ago) I got hyaluronic acid fillers injected into my chin to make it narrower‚Äù she told her more than 1 million Instagram followers on Tuesday. ‚ÄúI had a very bad infection; the product has been pouring out of my chin. It has been really bad.‚Äù Jessica explained that while the procedure was performed at a hair salon in Essex UK by someone who is ‚Äúnearly trained‚Äù she herself is to blame. ‚ÄúI am very experienced when it comes to plastic surgery and aesthetic procedures‚Äù she said. RELATED: ‚ÄòKen Doll‚Äôs‚Äô jaw-dropping bikini photo While it was performed by a trainee Jessica said it was her fault for insisting on having have the procedure which then lead to an infection. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram She described it as being ‚Äòvery bad‚Äô and ‚Äòvery deep‚Äô. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram RELATED: ‚ÄòHuman Ken doll‚Äô changes name ‚ÄúI have learned my lesson throughout the years but I insisted I needed that filler and now I have a big hole on my chin‚Äù adding it is the reason she covers it with a bandaid. Jessica explained the ordeal has been very ‚Äúfrustrating‚Äù as she removed the bandaid to show her followers how ‚Äúdeep‚Äù the hole is. The following day Jessica revealed she had a successful surgery to clear the infection and ‚Äúfix‚Äù the hole. The following day she had surgery to clear the infection and several other cosmetic procedures. Picture: Instagram/JessicaalvesukSource:Instagram She also had liposuction in her feet and calves to remove silicon a lip lift liposuction in her jaw and a ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù nose job as a ‚Äúgift‚Äù from her doctor. ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt expecting that‚Äù she said adding she is ‚Äúreally happy‚Äù with her overall surgery. However she took the time to advise those interested in cosmetic procedures to seek professional advice. ‚ÄúIf you do any injectable or fillers I advise you to have someone who is highly trained and experienced such as a doctor or plastic surgeon‚Äù Jessica said. The socialite admits she has ‚Äúput herself through so much plastic surgery and so much pain‚Äù ‚Äì and has even risked her own life. In 2016 Jessica known as Rodrigo at the time caught an infection after the sixth of her ten nose jobs. It left her unable to breathe as her body rejected the new nose. She then suffered necrosis ‚Äì an infection that sees the skin tissue die and wither away. She was rushed to a hospital in Malaga Spain when she saw a hole appear in her nose and doctors warned the condition could cause her nose to become gangrenous and would need to be removed before it ate into her face. Despite this she had four more reconstructive nose jobs ‚Äì one involving cartilage in her wrist being used to rebuild her nose. At the start of the year Jessica revealed that since transitioning to a woman she has ‚Äúnever felt better‚Äù. ‚ÄúI was very unhappy and I either had the transition or die. It was one or the other‚Äù she said. headline: Qld borders: Gladys Berejiklian lashes Palaszczuk on Kyle & Jackie O show
text: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has hit out at her Queensland counterpart saying the border closures simply don‚Äôt make sense. Scott Morrison has made an emotional plea for the Queensland Premier to allow a 26-year-old daughter to attend her father‚Äôs funeral today during a tearful radio interview. NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian speaks to the media during a press conference in Sydney Thursday May 7 2020. Picture: Dean Lewins/AAPSource:AAP NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has hit out at the Queensland Government saying she ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt understand‚Äù its border closure given both states have recorded similar coronavirus case numbers. Appearing on KIIS FM‚Äôs Kyle and Jackie O show Ms Berejiklian said the ongoing border closure between both states was creating ‚Äúhorrible‚Äù situations and causing ‚Äústress‚Äù on both sides of the border. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand what the Queensland Government does‚Äù Ms Berejiklian said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve said to them we don‚Äôt understand why they have the border up with NSW. ‚ÄúYesterday we had around the same cases ‚Ä¶ Why the border is still there I don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs really putting a downer and a stress on people.‚Äù Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has been criticised over her ongoing border closure with the southern states especially from national politicians who argue it is drastically impacting the Australian economy. RELATED: Follow our live coronavirus coverage NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian. Picture: Dean Lewins/AAPSource:AAP Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk. Picture: Dan Peled/NCA NewsWireSource:News Corp Australia Ms Palaszczuk‚Äôs policy has also been slammed for double standards after a pregnant northern NSW woman lost one of her unborn twins due to being forced to travel to a hospital in Sydney instead of one 40 minutes across the border in Queensland while 400 AFL employees and their families were openly welcomed into the state. The latest example of a family divided by the border closures is between dying Brisbane truck driver Mark Keans who has been told he has inoperable cancer and is unlikely to survive past Christmas. Mr Keans has been asked to choose which of his children to see as only one of four will be able to cross the border to Queensland to visit him before he dies. Ms Berejiklian described the situation as ‚Äúhorrible‚Äù and said it was time to banish the border with NSW. Police check cars at the Queensland border. Picture: Nigel HallettSource:News Corp Australia ‚ÄúIt is a horrible situation‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what we want to avoid. No matter what side of the border you are on it‚Äôs what we want to avoid. We are all Aussies. ‚ÄúOur numbers are roughly the same and we just need to support each other and support our communities rather than having this aspiration of zero (coronavirus) cases indefinitely because that‚Äôs just not possible to shut down an economy. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt eliminate because it keeps popping up. You can strive to have no cases but that‚Äôs a really hard ask.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: Karl Stefanovic‚Äôs plea after Sydney kids are banned from seeing dying Queensland dad
text: Today show host Karl Stefanovic has made an emotional plea live on air asking for a ‚Äúmedium‚Äù to be met when it comes to border closures. Karl Stefanovic has delivered a heartfelt message to Annastacia Palaszczuk on the Today show over her denial to let a dying man‚Äôs family cross into Queensland. Karl Stefanovic has pleaded with the Queensland Premier over border closures.Source:Supplied The grandfather of four Sydney kids prevented from seeing their dying father due to Queensland‚Äôs border lockdown has made a heartbreaking appearance on Today. Speaking with host Karl Stefanovic Bruce Langborne ‚Äì the father of terminally ill Brisbane truckie Mark Keans ‚Äì said it was a ‚Äúgut-wrenching‚Äù situation. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre fighting as hard as we can to get up there‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre bashing our heads against a brick wall but you‚Äôve just got to try to be as positive as possible. ‚ÄúMark is crook as a dog ‚Ä¶ he‚Äôs struggling he‚Äôs upset he can‚Äôt see anyone. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard. We‚Äôre locked out in his time of need and that‚Äôs hard because you want to be there and you can‚Äôt. It‚Äôs gut-wrenching.‚Äù When you have a family choosing which child should say goodbye to their father their dad it's gone too far. Karl's heart-wrenching response to the Queensland family who have to choose which child gets to say goodbye to their dying father due to border restrictions. #9Today pic.twitter.com/EpelyiGJdk Stefanovic also took aim at the harsh border closure saying that while he‚Äôs supported the Premier‚Äôs strength allowing the family to see Mr Keans was a ‚Äúno-brainer‚Äù. ‚ÄúWhen you have a family choosing which child should say goodbye to their father their dad it‚Äôs gone too far‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúGrant the exemption the Premier is not heartless but she needs to streamline this system while protecting Queenslanders. There is a medium. Let these kids say goodbye and let a dying man say goodbye.‚Äù Earlier NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian hit out at the Queensland Government saying she ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt understand‚Äù its border closure given both states have recorded similar coronavirus case numbers. She labelled Mr Keans‚Äô inability to see his four children as a ‚Äúhorrible situation‚Äù that could be resolved by a softened border. ‚ÄúIt is a horrible situation‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what we want to avoid. No matter what side of the border you are on it‚Äôs what we want to avoid. We are all Aussies. ‚ÄúOur numbers are roughly the same and we just need to support each other and support our communities rather than having this aspiration of zero cases indefinitely because that‚Äôs just not possible to shut down an economy. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt eliminate because it keeps popping up. You can strive to have no cases but that‚Äôs a really hard ask.‚Äù A NOTE ABOUT RELEVANT ADVERTISING: We collect information about the content (including ads) you use across this site and use it to make both advertising and content more relevant to you on our network and other sites. headline: Instagram star apologises for travel during pandemic after online backlash
text: A social media star who shared photos of her travels with her 3.3 million followers has been forced to apologise after copping a backlash. Instagrammers are spoiling once great and unique locations just to grab the perfect pic. Overcrowding bad behaviour and local unrest has seen popular tourist cities fight back. Influencer Charly Jordan has apologised for travelling overseas amid the coronavirus crisis. Picture: @charlyjordanSource:Instagram A social media star has apologised for travelling overseas amid the coronavirus health crisis sharing her side of the story after an alleged false-positive testing fiasco for COVID-19. American influencer Charly Jordan 21 who boasts a following of 3.3 million on Instagram and 1.8 million on TikTok said she did not have coronavirus when she arrived in Rwanda last week. RELATED: Follow the latest coronavirus updates  Influencer Charly Jordan. Picture: @charlyjordanSource:Instagram The Instagram star travelled to Rwanda during the pandemic. Picture: @charlyjordanSource:Instagram RELATED: ‚ÄòScared‚Äô: Influencer‚Äôs luxe holiday backfires The Independent reports that Rwanda is one of just 30 nations that United States citizens can currently visit amid the pandemic albeit with restrictions. According to the outlet Jordan had had the viral disease earlier this year and was told she could not get it again. With that being said the influencer insisted that she and her travel group followed all safety precautions before embarking on the two-week excursion. UPDATE: Charly Jordan responds to the backlash she received after testing positive for COVID while traveling in Rwanda. She explains it was a false positive and clarifies what she is doing in Africa. She also claims she took all safety precautions. She 1.8M TikTok followers. pic.twitter.com/lXLCHiecDu ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more difficult to travel right now but we took all the proper precautions even if that meant getting tested a million times. I‚Äôm definitely corona free haha‚Äù she wrote on Instagram on September 1. ‚Äú100 temperature checks later. Crazy where the world is right now.‚Äù In a video posted to her Instagram Stories on Monday and shared to Twitter the blogger said the trip was co-ordinated in partnership with a company ‚Äúto help bring awareness to endangered species of mountain gorillas‚Äù ‚Äì and took a turn for the worse on the third day. ‚ÄúThree days into the trip I got a false positive test‚Äù Jordan said. ‚ÄúI never had it but because I got the false positive I was locked in a little holding facility here in Kigali for the past four days where people spoke little to no English so it was very hard to get my point across that I didn‚Äôt have COVID and I already had it.‚Äù RELATED: Expat dishes on ‚Äòweird‚Äô life in Australia Jordan explained in a now-deleted TikTok video that she tested negative for COVID-19 following a second test four days later. From there she was free to leave isolation. ‚Äú(It) means their first test was wrong. They were wrong this whole time. I can leave!‚Äù she allegedly exclaimed of the news at the time. In the Monday clip Jordan said the Rwandan tourism board caught wind of her story after she spoke out on social media. Jordan apologised for travelling. Picture: @charlyjordanSource:Instagram She travelled to Rwanda for a two-week trip. Picture: @charlyjordanSource:Instagram ‚ÄúThey came to my hotel room last night and apologised for everything that was going on‚Äù she said. From there the influencer apologised for travelling during the pandemic and causing a commotion which was criticised online. ‚ÄúI would like to make an apology for travelling during this time because I know that it‚Äôs a very incorrect time to travel and I‚Äôm completely in the wrong for doing that and I have learned my lesson 100 per cent‚Äù Jordan said. ‚ÄúTrust me. I‚Äôve been sitting here in this room locked in this room for the past four days thinking about it and I will not be travelling anymore during this time. ‚ÄúI was completely in the wrong for travelling and I will not be doing that anymore‚Äù she said. headline: ‚ÄòHot‚Äô hunter sparks divide with kill snaps
text: A female hunter who amassed a huge following online with her ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù photos has defended her hobby after being bombarded with death threats. Petra Krchav√° 31 of Slovakia who has been hunting animals since she was just six years old has recently been subjected to death threats. Picture: Instagram/petrrissaSource:Supplied A Slovakian huntress has been subjected to death threats after posting pictures of herself with dead animals online. Petra Krchav√° 31 comes from a family of hunters with her passion for the hobby dating back 13 years. She was first introduced to hunting by her father Peter 56 when she was just six years old and has recently amassed a 40000 strong following online sharing photos of her escapades. But while some admire her hunting skills labelling Ms Krchav√° ‚Äúhot‚Äù and ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù ‚Äì others have condenmend the hobby. RELATED: Mum slammed for hunting with her baby  Petra Krchav√° 31 of Slovakia has been hunting animals since she was just six years old. Picture: Instagram/petrrissaSource:Supplied   She revealed she is bombarded with death threats from trolls. Picture: MDW Features/australscopeSource:australscope She said hunting is more of a lifestyle than a hobby. Picture: MDW Features/australscopeSource:australscope  ‚ÄúPeople have wished me the same death as the animals I‚Äôve harvested. People think we kill animals for fun which is not the case at all‚Äù Ms Krchav√° said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been told ‚ÄòI wish you‚Äôd shoot each other‚Äô‚Äù she claimed. RELATED: Hunter‚Äôs snap of leopard kill sparks outrage Petra who‚Äôs dad taught her to hunt says she has spent thousands of dollars contributing to conservation efforts. Picture: MDW Features/australscopeSource:australscope Despite the threats the hunter claims the welfare of the animals is her number one priority. ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt see that I feed the animals to make sure they survive the winter.‚Äù Ms Krchav√° said she spends thousands of dollars contributing to conservation efforts. ‚ÄúI distribute drinking water in summer and build feeding facilities ‚Ä¶ We dig lakes give them medicine save young and other injured animals and organise waste collection outings. ‚ÄúWe teach children in schools and run educational summer camps.‚Äù She said the money was spent on feeding wild animals providing medicine and building lakes. Picture: MDW Features/australscopeSource:australscope She also runs educational programs for young children saying it‚Äôs important to preserve nature. Picture: MDW Features/australscopeSource:australscope Last year however Ms Krchav√° said she took a break from the hobby after witnessing another hunter accidentally shot and allegedly killed just 80 metres from her. While she found it difficult to love hunting in the same way she had previously she said her determination to protect animals for future generations prevailed. ‚ÄúHunting is never just about the hunt. There‚Äôs so much time energy and care that goes into it but most people don‚Äôt realise this‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWhen we process the game meat it‚Äôs something shared by family friends and our village. It‚Äôs the healthiest meat a person can eat. ‚ÄúThere are no toxic products used. I know exactly what happened to that animal.‚Äù She explained during the current coronavirus crisis her family have been able to be self-sufficient when supermarkets lacked supply. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had people reach out to me to thank me for what I do for nature. Adults sometimes ask me how we can pass this message on to young people too‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important that we preserve nature for future generations. I hope I can teach my own child this one day.‚Äù Ms Krchav√° is also in the process of creating a clothing line to fundraise for the western capercaillie an endangered species of bird in the grouse family. headline: Singapore family ‚Äòhit the jackpot‚Äô with luxury Ritz Carlton hotel quarantine
text: Hotel quarantine has been a gruelling slog for most travellers but a mum and her young son were surprised to snag a five-star dream.  Hotel quarantine breaches are responsible for the Victorian outbreak and now the appalling conditions inside are under scrutiny. A mum and bub got lucky when they were sent for mandatory hotel quarantine in one of Singapore's fanciest stays. Picture: @ritzcarltonmilleniasingaporeSource:Instagram A mum and her toddler who travelled to Singapore have hit the hotel jackpot by being sent to a luxury Ritz-Carlton hotel to complete their mandatory 14-day hotel quarantine.  Joy Van Dee recently arrived on the island from Amsterdam and said she was shocked to be shuttled to the Ritz-Carlton Millenia Singapore for the government-mandated COVID-19 quarantine The Wall Street Journal reports. ‚ÄúWe hit the jackpot‚Äù Ms Van Dee told the outlet on Monday explaining she didn‚Äôt realise where she‚Äôd be staying until she was taken there. RELATED: Follow the latest coronavirus updates RELATED: Hotel guards having sex tried to keep it secret The woman and her baby son stuck out the two weeks in a cushy 51sq m room with river views. They were sent at random to the five-star hotel for Singapore‚Äôs ‚Äúquarantine lottery‚Äù. ‚ÄúNo one has any choice in where they go and bus drivers shuttling travellers from the airport won‚Äôt say where they are headed‚Äù the Journal reports of the system. According to the outlet most travellers have to cough up about $1600 per person per hotel room and COVID-19 test for the 14-day quarantine. The swanky stay Ms Van Dee and her son enjoyed however is reportedly valued at an even prettier penny; the cheapest room offered at the hotel for two weeks in early October is priced at almost $5850 with taxes and fees. The family‚Äôs quirky quarantine experience wasn‚Äôt quite the same as a stay at the Ritz in pre-pandemic times however ‚Äì people cannot leave their rooms housekeeping does not visit and meals are left outside the bedrooms. It‚Äôs also a far cry from the experience of other quarantined travellers including in Australia where guests have complained about ‚Äúprison-like‚Äù terrible food dirty rooms and poor hygiene standards. Since the pandemic began more than half of Singapore‚Äôs 67000 hotel rooms have been reassigned to quarantine-arriving travellers as well as locals infected with COVID-19 Yahoo Lifestyle reports. headline: Kris Jenner ended KUWTK before Kanye West could damage it further
text: The Kar-Jenner matriarch reportedly had the reality show canned because one family member has become too much of a ‚Äòloose cannon‚Äô. Keeping Up with the Kardashians is coming to an end after 14 years so let‚Äôs take a look back at all of the craziest feuds. Kris Jenner reportedly ‚Äòpulled the plug‚Äô on the show because of Kim‚Äôs husband. Picture: AFP.Source:AFP Kris Jenner ‚Äúpulled the plug‚Äù on Keeping Up With The Kardashians over fears Kanye West was causing ‚Äúirreversible damage‚Äù to their brand The Sun reports. Family sources close to the matriarch told the publication she had ‚Äúhad enough‚Äù of her daughter Kim Kardashian‚Äôs unpredictable husband. The insider claimed the rapper had ‚Äútried to constantly fight with Kris over production and the direction that the show is going‚Äù. But headstrong Kris ‚Äúwas not about to let anybody take the reins‚Äù. RELATED: ‚ÄòGoodbye‚Äô: Kim announces end of KUWTK Kanye and Kris reportedly disagreed on production decisions for the show. Picture: Getty Images.Source:Getty Images In recent months Kanye battled a public mental health breakdown and shocked fans by sharing intimate details of his marriage and family life. The source admitted that his behaviour had become ‚Äúuncontrollable‚Äù and Kris knew she ‚Äùneeded to pull the plug before he does irreversible damage to her brand.‚Äù ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs become a loose cannon and she cannot tolerate it anymore‚Äù. A separate source close to the family insisted this is ‚Äúabsolutely false‚Äù. In July Kanye called mother-in-law Kris a ‚Äúwhite supremacist‚Äù and ‚ÄúKris Jong-un‚Äù in a series of tweets and claimed he had previously tried to divorce Kim. RELATED: Wildest KUWTK moments in history Kanye has sparked concern for his mental health in recent months. Picture: AFP.Source:AFP It came after a campaign rally for his presidential bid in July where he wept as he revealed Kim had almost aborted their eldest daughter North. Though he apologised for his comments he later doubled down and repeated the abortion story on Nick Cannon‚Äôs podcast. The rapper shares 7-year-old North 4-year-old Saint 2-year-old Chicago and 1-year-old Psalm with wife Kim. KUWTK COMING TO AN END Yesterday Kim Kardashian publicly announced she and her family have made the ‚Äúdifficult decision‚Äù to say goodbye to the reality show that made them household names. ‚ÄúIt is with heavy hearts that we‚Äôve made the difficult decision as a family to say goodbye to Keeping Up with the Kardashians‚Äù the reality star and beauty mogul announced on Instagram following months of intense scrutiny about her turbulent marriage to the rapper-turned-Presidential hopeful. Keeping Up with the Kardashians first hit screens in 2007. Picture: AFP.Source:AFP ‚ÄúAfter what will be 14 years 20 seasons hundreds of episodes and numerous spin-off shows we are beyond grateful to all of you who‚Äôve watched us for all of these years ‚Äì through the good times the bad times the happiness the tears and the many relationships and children. We‚Äôll forever cherish the wonderful memories and countless people we‚Äôve met along the way.‚Äù Kardashian thanked the ‚Äúthousands of individuals and businesses that have been a part of this experience‚Äù and reveals that the final season of Keeping Up with the Kardashians will air early next year. The latest season filmed during the coronavirus pandemic will hit Binge on September 18. RELATED: Kardashian clan before and after The star ‚Äì who was best known as Paris Hilton‚Äôs assistant when she made her foray into reality TV with occasional cameos on The Simple Life ‚Äì acknowledged just how much KUWTK had changed her family‚Äôs lives. You can watch season 18 of Keeping Up With the Kardashians on Binge Australia‚Äôs new streaming service offering the best drama entertainment and movies from the world‚Äôs best creators. New to Binge? Get a two week free trial. Sign up at binge.com.au ‚ÄúWithout Keeping Up with The Kardashians I wouldn‚Äôt be where I am today. I am so incredibly grateful to everyone who has watched and supported me and my family these past 14 incredible years. This show made us who we are and I will be forever in debt to everyone who played a role in shaping our careers and changing our lives forever‚Äù she wrote. KIM AND KANYE‚ÄôS VERY PUBLIC TURMOIL The family‚Äôs surprise decision to ditch the reality show that made them stars came after increased attention on the tumultuous relationship between Kim and Kanye. The rapper is continuing his bizarre bid to run for President during the November US elections and in July slammed his wife and her family on social media accusing Kim and Kris Jenner of trying to ‚Äúlock him up‚Äù. After the series of shocking tweets Kim released a statement in July in which she defended her husband and made mention of his bipolar disorder. Kim Kardashian spoke publicly for the first time about her husband‚Äôs bipolar in a statement on Instagram. Picture: Getty Images.Source:Getty Images ‚ÄúAnyone who has this or has a loved one in their life who does knows how incredibly complicated and painful it is to understand‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never spoken publicly about how this has affected us at home because I am very protective of our children and Kanye‚Äôs right to privacy when it comes to his health. ‚ÄúThose that understand mental illness or compulsive behaviour know that the family is powerless unless the member is a minor‚Äù she went on. ‚ÄúPeople who are unaware or far removed from this experience can be judgmental and not understand that the individual themselves have to engage in the process of getting help no matter how hard the family try.‚Äù This story originally appeared in The Sun and was reproduced here with permission. Keeping Up With the Kardashians Season 19 premieres Friday 18th September - same day as the U.S. Watch on E! at 10am and 8:30pm on Foxtel or Fetch. headline: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry‚Äôs list of demands for speaking events revealed
text: An exhaustive four-page document outlines Harry and Meghan‚Äôs strict rules of engagement as they step into post-royal public life.  Excessive baby showers rent-free mansion living and private jets ‚Äì inside the free royal perks of the Duke and Duchess. Prince Harry and Meghan Markle signed a deal with Netflix estimated to be worth $150 million. Picture: AFPSource:AFP Meghan Markle and Prince Harry‚Äôs list of strict demands for their speaking events has been leaked ‚Äì and it‚Äôs quite the novella. In an exhaustive four-page document the Duke and Duchess of Sussex outline their stringent rules for any speaking engagement ‚Äì including that they have the final say in who introduces them. Earlier this year the couple reportedly signed with The Harry Walker Agency an exclusive agency that boasts it represents the best in motivational speakers. It is thought the couple could charge up to $1.4 million for each appearance. RELATED: Harry and Meghan‚Äôs payback means they‚Äôre on their own Harry and Meghan have a long list of demands for speaking appearances. Picture: Paul Edwards/WPA Pool/GettySource:Getty Images The Telegraph today revealed the stipulations issued by Harry 35 and Meghan 39 including that the fee must be paid in advance. The leaked ‚ÄòVirtual Event Request Form‚Äô also states: ‚ÄúThe choice of introducer and moderator will be at the final discretion of the speaker. ‚ÄúThe fee will need to be paid directly from the contracting organisation‚Äôs account.‚Äù The full audience list must also be provided and whether the couple need to wear ‚Äúbusiness or casual‚Äù attire. Other commands insist details of the sponsors must be listed asking: ‚ÄúIf you were to lose one or more of the above sponsors would your organisation still be able to move forward with this event?‚Äù Harry and Meghan started to hit the speaking circuit before the coronavirus lockdown hit ‚Äì with the Prince giving a speech in Miami for JP Morgan in February. The royal was reportedly paid a six-figure sum for the keynote speech which saw him reveal he had been in therapy for years after the death of his mother Princess Diana. The pair are following in the footsteps of other big names to sign up with the agency which also represents Barack and Michelle Obama Bill and Hillary Clinton and Oprah Winfrey. Last week it was revealed Meghan and Harry had signed a deal with Netflix to produce content that ‚Äúgives hope‚Äù to audiences with the deal estimated to be worth $150 million. MULTI-MILLION DOLLAR DEAL Just days after the deal was announced the couple confirmed they had paid back the full $4.3 million spent on refurbishing their home in the UK Frogmore Cottage. The couple is now based in the US ‚Äì recently buying up a huge $20 million Santa Barbara home to start their new life with son Archie. The leaked list of stipulations from the couple comes after they quit the royal family earlier this year. RELATED: Meghan and Harry‚Äôs big risk with Netflix deal The couple is transitioning from royals to Netflix celebs. Picture: Chris Jackson/GettySource:Getty Images RELATED: Truth about Harry and Meghan‚Äôs finances revealed  And one of the authors of Finding Freedom ‚Äì an unauthorised biography released last month detailing the couple‚Äôs decision to quit the Firm ‚Äì claimed the pair had been frustrated at leaks coming from the palace. Author Omid Scobie said the couple struggled with the royal family‚Äôs ‚Äúno comment policy‚Äù. Labelling it a ‚ÄúHR crisis‚Äù Scobie continued: ‚ÄúTo have members of their team or family that they are part of being involved in some of their leaks was an extremely unpleasant situation for them and made them feel even more unsupported and unprotected. ‚ÄúBut you have to remember this is one very big establishment and what lies within are three very different households and agendas all looking after their own bosses and own agendas. It left them very exposed.‚Äù In August Scobie said Harry and Meghan were ‚Äútold not to defend themselves‚Äù after palace insiders branded her ‚ÄúDuchess Difficult‚Äù.
